Description: Like others from this producer, the Montepulciano is not shy in the alcohol or oak departments, but offers heaps of character and charm to make up for it. Supple cherry and blueberry fruit is woven with violets, tobacco, bay leaf and licorice. Full bodied, the well structured and textured tannins and lifted acidity nicely temper the plush fruit. Drink now–2029 with a plate of antipasti. A nod towards central Italy with Marlborough at its core.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Hans Family Estate 2015 Secret of Marlborough Montepulciano (Marlborough)

Description: Bright aromas of wild berries, forest floor, baking spice and whiffs of eucalyptus and new leather form the nose. Made from native grape Malvasia Nera, it's fresh and savory, doling out juicy Marasca cherry, blackberry, star anise and a hint of aromatic herbs alongside polished tannins and tangy acidity. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Meleto 2018 Camboi Malvasia Nera (Toscana)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture Superiore, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: An earthy, refined nose of condensed red cherry, cranberry, violet and truffle starts off this Aglianico sourced from the Piano di Croce vineyard in Barile. There's a real sense of elegance on the palate, where lifted elements of violet and crushed stone bring power and poise to the rich berry fruit. It's an unforced expression that gives a real sense of place. Drink through 2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Basilisco 2016 Cruà  (Aglianico del Vulture Superiore)

Description: Made in tiny amounts from the historic site still farmed by the Tofanelli family, this wine offers plum, blueberry, leather and old-vine complexity—the tannins grippy but elongated and eventually supple. It has fresh, lively acidity that keeps if crisp and inviting throughout.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Matt Morris 2018 Tofanelli Vineyard Charbono (Napa Valley)

Description: From grower Peter Heitz and winemaker Françoise Peschon, this rare breed is plummy and rich in dark chocolate. Soft on the palate, it dashes through highlights of dusty sage, cranberry and Christmas spice before finding its foundation of vibrant structure on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Matt Morris 2018 Shypoke Vineyard Charbono (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture Superiore, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Rich aromas of truffle, violet, plum and cherry are dense on the nose of this red that spent 12 months in half new and half used oak. There's immense polish and verve to the palate, with silken, seductive tannins wrapping around all the luscious berry fruit. Yet with all that, there's still ample lift from fresh acidity, making this a well-balanced, plush red.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Re Manfredi 2013 Serpara  (Aglianico del Vulture Superiore)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Plush aromas of violet, juniper, cherry and bramble berry burst on the nose. Medium in weight, there's a driven, ample feel to the juicy red-cherry and blackberry flavors, with bits of tar and pressed rose arising on the midpalate. Yet, throughout the whole experience, bouncy berry fruit and zesty crushed mineral tones remain constant. There's structure and poise to this wine that makes it enjoyable to drink now, but it will also hold well through 2028.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Elena Fucci 2018 Titolo  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of condensed red cherry and spiced plum blend with earthy accents of truffle, leather and gravel in this red that sees time in French tonneaux. Sourced from 80-year-old vines, it's a dense, rich expression that shows taut cherry and blackberry flavors peppered with earthy, savory spices. A driving mineral tone gives energy to it all, with polished tannins lending an accessible feel. Drink now–2025.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Musto Carmelitano 2013 Pian del Moro  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture Superiore, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Sourced from a vineyard over sixty years old in the village of Ginestra, this red offers a perfumed nose of cinnamon, clove and brandy-dipped cherries. There polish and poise to the medium-bodied palate, as the juicy mix of berries melds with a zesty crushed mineral core. That mineral note brings immense lift and length to it all. Velvety tannins give it an approachable vibe in the near term, but this should hold well through 2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Grifalco 2015 Daginestra  (Aglianico del Vulture Superiore)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Enveloping aromas of cherry coulis, pomegranate molasses, anise seed and blood orange carry over to the rich yet deftly balanced palate. There's intense energy to the coiled red-berry flavors, with a mineral zip propelling it along while polished tannins firmly wrap it all up. Drink now–2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Paternoster 2016 Don Anselmo  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture Superiore, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Sourced from the San Martino cru in the village of Maschito, this is a polished, elegant Aglianico from vines over sixty years old. Aromas of brandy-dipped cherry, rooibos, vanilla and violet perfume the nose and extend to the juicy yet taut palate. There's plushness to the tannins that makes this accessible in the near term, but it should hold well through 2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Grifalco 2015 Damaschito  (Aglianico del Vulture Superiore)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: There's ample richness to the wild-blueberry and red-cherry aromas on the nose, with violet and truffle chiming in. It's polished and plump in feel yet honed by juicy acidity and a mesh of fine tannins. This shows accessibility in spades but also a good amount of drive; drink now through 2025.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Macarico 2017  Aglianico del Vulture

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A delightful mix of crushed rock, red berries, pink peppercorn and violet drive the nose. There's polish to the palate, where coiled red-berry fruit is propelled along an immensely tangy river of crushed stones. It's a stripped back expression of the variety that shows elegance and power in tandem. Drink through 2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Elena Fucci 2016 Titolo  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Rich aromas of anise, cola and cigar box combine into the dense brandy-soaked cherry on the nose. It's creamy and full on the palate, with luscious berry fruit wrapped in warm, toasty spices. There's a polish to it all, with racing acidity driving it along. Drink through 2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Paternoster 2017 Rotondo  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Initially reserved on the nose, with time in the glass this amphora-aged wine opens up to reveal aromas of dark mixed berries, crushed rock, violet and Mediterranean scrub. There's richness to dark fruit on the palate, with a pulsing mineral tone driving throughout. It's coiled and brooding currently, built by a strong framing of tannins that need time to settle. Drink 2023–2033.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Elena Fucci 2017 Titolo by Amphora  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Description: Aromas of dried cranberry, pomegranate, rose and violet meld with an earthy truffle note on the nose. It's polished and poised on the palate, with a savory crushed-stone element propelling along coiled red-berry flavors. It's a lifted, elegant Aglianico to enjoy now until 2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: D'Angelo 2017 Canneto Aglianico (Basilicata)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Rich aromas of bacon fat, toasted anise and dark cocoa powder ride on the dense dark-berry fruit on the nose. It's full and creamy on the palate, with concentrated black-cherry and blueberry flavors wrapped in warm, toasty spices. There's immense lift from the driving acidity and a delightful polish from suave tannins. Drink now–2028.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Vigneti del Vulture 2016 Piano del Cerro  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of spiced bramble berries, violet and slightly singed resinous herbs carry the nose and echo on the palate. Juicy fruit fills it all out, with a slick of granite lending a zesty mineral twang. There's real drive and energy to it all, with cherry skins lingering on the close. Drink through 2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Elena Fucci 2017 Titolo  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture Superiore, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of ripe red cherry and pomegranate meld with violet and crushed rock in this accessible yet well structured Aglianico. There's a gentle creaminess to the palate, with taut berry fruit drawing it out and a fine mesh of tannins reining it in. It's a supple expression of the variety that still show the energy and drive typical of Vulture. Drink now–2028.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Basilisco 2016 Fontanelle  (Aglianico del Vulture Superiore)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: There's an earthy, wild edge on the nose of this wine, showing spicy bramble berries, truffle, violet and crushed pink peppercorn. The palate is silken and velvety in feel, filled out by juicy cherry and blackberry flavors and accented by delightful earthy tones. There's a gentle rustic nature to it all, but pleasingly so.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: D'Angelo 2013 Tecum  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This new bottling by Elena Fucci utilizes grapes from a neighboring vineyard of vines over seventy years old that were at risk of going untended. The name Sceg, means pomegranate in Arbëreshë, which is a dialect spoken by Albanians who emigrated to southern Italy centuries ago. Bright aromas of violet, pressed cherries and dried hibiscus are fresh on the nose of the wine. It's rounded and juicy on the palate, yet featherlight in feel. There's a nice balance between the bursting berry fruit and supple tannins, with cherry skins and a light violet tone lingering on the close. It's approachable in its youth and should be enjoyed in the near term.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Elena Fucci 2018 Sceg  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of wild forest berries meld with alpine herbs, violets and nori in this savory red. Aged in stainless steel and cement, it's all about the fruit on the palate. Soft red-berry flavors build on the entry and evolve into bright, popping, juicy fruit tones. Well-honed tannins sidle it all, with a zesty crushed stone element lifting it up. This is a beautiful Aglianico that has nothing to hide.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Musto Carmelitano 2015 Serra del Prete  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: It's exciting to see this Sicilian grape grown in the warmer reaches of eastern Paso Robles. Aromas of black-plum paste, dried ginger, candied rose, star anise and toasted oak entertain the nose. The palate offers baked boysenberry and dark strawberry as well as more oak spice, all framed by sandy tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Broken Earth 2019 Nero d'Avola (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of cinnamon, anise and rooibos meld with the wild-cherry and raspberry core in this red. The medium-bodied palate is soft in flavors of baked raspberry and cherry, accented by gentle warm spices. There's good balance to it all, with polished tannins and fresh acidity lending support, but it should be enjoyed in the near term.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantine del Notaio 2013 La Firma  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Perfumed aromas of violet, tilled earth and blood orange meet a rich red-cherry core on the nose. There's polish and poise on the palate, with a zesty mineral tone pushing along. Smoothed tannins are enveloped in the fruit, making this accessible in the near term. Drink now through 2028.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Regio Cantina 2017 Donpà  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Violet, walnut skin, pomegranate and red cherry meet a brisk pink-peppercorn note on the vibrant nose. This is smoothed and polished on the palate, with a tangy, driven line of crushed minerals pushing it along. Coiled red fruit jumps throughout, with crushed stones lingering on the close. There's suppleness to the fruit but immense drive, indicating this will hold well for some time. Drink now until 2026.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Macarico 2018 Macarì  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: There's a wild, earthy edge to the nose of this single-vineyard wine, with aromas of forest berries, violet, truffle and a slight hint of barnyard. There's drive and poise to the palate, where cherry and blackberry flavors are wrapped in earth and floral accents. There's an accessibility to the tannins that makes this enjoyable now, but it should hold well through 2028.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: D'Angelo 2015 Casselle  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: An aroma of brandy-soaked blueberries mixes with violet and truffle on the rich nose. It's rather full in feel on the palate, with polished, rounded tannins propping up rich dark-fruit flavors. Pulsing acidity and a stony core add to the energetic vibe, making this a wine to enjoy with some age on it. Drink from 2022–2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Basilisco 2017 Teodosio  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture Superiore, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Rich, enveloping aromas of coconut, dark chocolate, leather and mint start off this Aglianico. It's full in feel on the palate, with copious warm spices wrapped around the dense dark-berry and plum core. There's good polish to the tannins and plenty of fresh acidity to lend balance.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina di Venosa 2013 Carato Venusio  (Aglianico del Vulture Superiore)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Rich aromas of cocoa powder and carob ride over the dense dark-berry core on the nose. Wild-berry flavors are wrapped in cinnamon and clove accents on the palate, with integrated tannins and fresh acidity lending support. It's accessible now and should hold well through 2025.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantine del Notaio 2015 Il Repertorio  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of brandy-dipped cherries, tobacco and warm spices are forward on the nose. There's polish and drive to the medium-bodied palate, with pulsing acidity pushing along flavors of tart cherry wrapped in toasty spices. It ends on a sweet oak tone, but pleasingly so, with the rich fruit anchoring it all.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina di Venosa 2017 Gesualdo da Venosa  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Well concentrated aromas of black raspberry, pomegranate, violet and freshly turned earth carry the nose of this rustic red. It's light in profile, with zesty berry flavors wrapped in mildly gritty tannins. There's charm to be had among the delightful mix of juicy fruit and earthy tones. Enjoy at the dinner table alongside lamb or venison.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: D'Angelo 2017  Aglianico del Vulture

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Cohesive aromas of mixed berries, anise seed, cigar box and mentholated herb drive the nose. Concentrated blueberry and dark-cherry flavors are pushed along by pulsing acidity and tangy crushed granite. There's a grip to the slightly grainy tannins, but it's nothing a protein couldn't temper. Enjoy with food and this wine will sing.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Grifalco 2017  Aglianico del Vulture

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Raspy aromas of blackberry and cherry meld with crushed alpine herbs and mentholated tobacco on the nose. There's grip and gusto to the palate, where taut berry flavors are pushed along by bright acidity. Tense tannins ground it all and need some time to settle. Drink from 2022.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Re Manfredi 2015  Aglianico del Vulture

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Bright, bouncy aromas of wild cherry and blueberry meld with a mentholated edge on the nose. The palate is driven by juicy acidity, with tannins taking the back seat. There's good grip, energy and length, but ultimately this can be enjoyed in the near term. Drink now through 2025.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Macarico 2018  Aglianico del Vulture

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: There's good concentration to the aromas of bramble berry, wild cherry, violet and hibiscus on the nose, offering an enticing mix of fruit and earth elements. The medium-bodied palate is juicy in tart cherry and blackberry flavors, with pretty floral accents on the sides. The tannins are resolved yet supportive while bright acidity and a tangy mineral note push everything along.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina di Venosa 2018 Balì  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Ripe red cherry, anise, tobacco and sweet sawdust aromas carry the nose. There's a supple, easygoing feel to the palate, with juicy, rounded cherry and raspberry flavors wrapped in mildly gripping tannins.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Macarico 2019 Macarì  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture Superiore, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of baked plum and bramble berry mix with iodine, brown sugar and straw in this red. There's an austerity to the palate, with an earthy rooibos tone throughout and juicy black fruit arising on the midpalate. Copious fine-grained tannins ride in the background, giving a slight crunch to the feel.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Basilisco 2015 Fiordimarna  (Aglianico del Vulture Superiore)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture Superiore, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Feint aromas of blackberry and cherry meld with a hint of rubber on the nose. It's rounded and plush in feel on the palate, filled out by juicy dark-berry flavors. There's a slight grit to the tannins, but they still play well with the fruit, making this a lively, crunchy red.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Basilisco 2013  Aglianico del Vulture Superiore

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture Superiore, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A delicate nose of geranium, warm spice, red berries and tilled earth starts off this red. It's plush in feel on the palate, with soft berry flavors wrapped in accents of anise and clove. Integrated tannins lend a rounded vibe, with just enough acidity to keep it fresh. Drink in the near term.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Regio Cantina 2015 Campo Melograno Riserva  (Aglianico del Vulture Superiore)

Description: Aromas of red cherry, hibiscus, violet and tilled earth show nicely on the nose. It's deft on the palate, offering flavors of tart red cherry and blackberry lifted by a zesty mineral core. The tannins are soft yet supportive, with juicy acidity driving it all. This is a tasty, youthful Aglianico that should be enjoyed in the near term.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: D'Angelo 2018 Sacravite Aglianico (Basilicata)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Lifted aromas of red cherry, sun-baked earth and dried cranberry are straightforward yet delightful on the nose. There's polish to the rather light-bodied palate, where tart red-berry fruit pulses along. Tart acidity is the driver here, with a fine mesh of tannins riding in the background. This is an accessible entry-level Aglianico.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Paternoster 2017 Synthesi  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of tar, pressed rose, rubber and blueberry carry to the medium-bodied palate, where accents of anise and cinnamon chime in. The fruit and tannins are slightly viscous but bright acidity does well to lift it all up.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina di Venosa 2018 Terre di Orazio  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Mildly expressive tones of black cherry, iodine and charred herbs carry this medium-bodied red. Pulsing acidity pushes it along, with cinched tannins clipping the fruit on the finish. It's overall a brisk expression of the variety.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Grifalco 2017 Gricos  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A bit closed on the nose, this reveals notes of cocoa, potpourri and wet cement with some time in the glass. There's nice roundness to the medium-bodied palate, with tart red and black berries never relenting. The acidity is pulsing and veers sour, with a mildly green oak tone arising on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Vigneti del Vulture 2018 Pipoli  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Grown from a grape native to the family's Italian hometown, this darkly colored wine begins with surprisingly subtle aromas of boysenberry, black plum and spice cake. Sandy tannins frame the dark-plum and sandalwood flavors, which are dissected by a mineral streak of rust and blood. The elegance will only shine with time. Drink now–2033.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bargetto 2018 Regan Vineyards Dolcetto (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of just-pressed grapes, white rose and orange rind form the nose. On the elegantly foaming, tangy palate, crisp acidity lifts juicy strawberry, tart red cherry and hints of baking spice.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa di Corlo NV Metodo Classico Elettra Brut Rosé  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Description: A superdark color and rich black-fig and blackberry aromas carry the nose. Broad, ripe blackberry and blueberry flavors are blanketed by light tannins that help balance out the jammy richness. It's a big, fun, enjoyable wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: LangeTwins 2017 Jahant Woods 02 Vineyard Teroldego (Jahant)

Description: Aspects of flint and iron inflect the aromas and flavors of this full-bodied, smoky and savory wine. Hardly a fruit-bomb, the medium-bodied palate has a nervy, slightly tannic texture and an adventurous set of flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: LangeTwins 2018 Redtail Vineyard Nero d'Avola (Jahant)

Description: Soft and supple in rustic blueberry, cranberry and cherry, this is a big, bold wine with considerable tannins that integrate with ease. Toasted oak notes carry it through a long finish of leathery baking spice and cocoa powder.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Trentadue 2017 Old Orchard Estate Montepulciano (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This dense, tannic and concentrated wine holds its deep blueberry, cranberry and woodsmoke flavors tightly. It's a rare varietal in California and requires either patience on the part of the drinker or an indulgent, rich dish to pair it with. Best after 2028.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Portalupi 2018 L Venturi Vineyard Charbono (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is whole-cluster fermented via carbonic maceration, providing a lasting freshness and verve on the palate. Light and delicate in color and structure, this wine is simple, focused and food-friendly, fruity in plum and wild grape, ideally served chilled.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Whipsmart Wine Company 2019 One Fine Morning Dolcetto (Russian River Valley)

Description: Savory and elegant, this lithe red has inviting aromas of crushed berry, violet, star anise and botanical herb. The linear, juicy palate delivers Morello cherry, star anise and a hint of bitter almond alongside graceful tannins and bright acidity. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sandrone 2018  Dolcetto d'Alba

Appellation: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Deeply colored, dry and lightly fizzy, this has aromas of blue flower and blackberry jam. On the foaming, savory palate, zesty acidity and light tannins accompany ripe black cherry and a hint of white pepper.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa di Corlo 2019 Corleto  (Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro)

Description: This deeply colored wine opens with aromas of baked plum, underbrush and cedar. Made with 100% Colorino, the solid palate offers ripe blackberry, mocha and white pepper alongside firm tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Palazzino 2016 Stagi Colorino (Toscana)

Description: Made with the red grape Corvina (of Amarone and Valpolicella fame), this blanc de noir sparkler has aromas of toasted bread crust and nut. The aromas carry over to the lively palate along with acacia honey and an invigorating perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Damoli NV AvantGarde Nature Corvina (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Modena, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Vinous aromas of just pressed grapes and a whiff of violet form the nose. The aromas follow over to the simple, lightly sparkling palate along with juicy raspberry, black cherry and crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Settecani di Castelvetro NV Vini del Re  (Lambrusco di Modena)

Description: Cola, roasted veggies and black-pepper notes combine in this rather lean, dry, moderately tannic wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Fasi Estate 2019 Estate Charbono (Madera)

Description: Aromas of cassis, camphor, French oak and blue flowers form the expressive nose. Full-bodied and elegantly structured, the smooth, delicious palate doles out succulent Morello cherry, spiced blueberry, licorice and tobacco. It's well-balanced, with taut, refined tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Allegrini 2016 La Poja Corvina (Veronese)

Description: There's depth and richness to the dark plum and cherry fruit on the nose, with heaps of fresh oregano, thyme and field flowers chiming in. This iconic estate winery located in the province of Teramo is one of the leaders of biodynamics in the region, which translates to the purity and balance of the fruit in this wine. Fleshy yet taut plum and dark cherry flavors are framed by polished tannins and fresh acidity, with more herbs chiming in on the lingering finish. It's enjoyable now but could hold well through 2028.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Emidio Pepe 2012  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: This top-of-the-line Montepulciano impresses in rich aromas of cocoa, cigar box, dill and anise that meld into a deep well of brandy-soaked black cherry and dark plum. It's full and enveloping on the palate yet foursquare in nature, built by small-grained, polished tannins and integrated acidity that frame densely packed dark fruit. Spiced plums linger on the long finish, indicating that this will hold well in the cellar. Drink 2022–2030 at least.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Masciarelli 2015 Villa Gemma Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Dense aromas of black plum and blackberry are lifted by accents of crushed herbs and chopped mint in this Montepulciano that sees 23 months in large, untoasted Slavonian casks. There's polish to the plump fruit on the palate, with a seamless feel to the integrated tannins and bright acidity. Not a hair is out of place in this poised red. Drink now–2026.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Amorotti 2016  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: Made with bush-trained pre-phylloxera vines, this fascinating wine needs time to breathe before releasing intense aromas of menthol, dried earth, ripe black-skinned berry and star anise. The aromas carry on to the smooth, juicy palate along with ripe plum, black cherry, vanilla and a hint of iron. Soft tannins provide gentle support.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Montoni 2016 Vrucara Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Freshly pressed blackberries, cherries and cranberries take on earthy elements of crushed herbs and gravel in this amphora-aged Montepulciano. There's a polished, supple feel to the berry fruit on the medium-bodied palate, with streaks of crushed mineral and earthy spice lending depth. The finish lingers long on a bright cherry-skin note.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Francesco Cirelli 2018  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: Aromas of brandy-soaked dark cherry, anise, allspice and chopped mint show depth, concentration and purity in this Montepulciano that sees time in French oak. It's rich in feel on the palate, but counterbalanced by a bright core of acidity that pushes along the dense berry and spice flavors. There's a polish to it all that makes it accessible in the near term, but it would also hold well through 2028.                      Alexander Peartree
Designation: Marina Cvetic S. Martino Rosso Riserva
Name: Masciarelli 2018 Marina Cvetic S. Martino Rosso Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: A more serious version of Frappato, this savory red has enticing aromas of Mediterranean herb, blue flower, wild berry and sea breeze. Smooth, elegant and medium-bodied, the lithe palate doles out juicy black cherry, strawberry compote, white pepper and hints of star anise alongside supple tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paolo Calì 2017 Mandragola Frappato (Vittoria)

Description: Densely packed aromas of brandy-soaked plums and blackberries meld with seamless accents of allspice and tobacco in this brooding red. Rich in feel on the palate, a luscious black plum flavor is wrapped in a blanket of polished tannins and propped up by unwavering acidity. There's sheen and depth to this red that needs some time to unravel. Drink 2022–2028.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina Tollo 2015 Cagiòlo Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Dense aromas of brandy-dipped cherries and blackberries meld with firm doses of tobacco, anise and cardamom in this sultry red. The full-bodied palate is rounded and supple in feel, with concentrated dark berry and plum flavors that are lifted by a mix of sweet and savory spices. A firm webbing of tannins holds it all together, never detracting from the fruit. Drink now.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Terra d'Aligi 2016 Tatone  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Enticing aromas of red berry, baking spice and blue flower meld together in the glass along with a whiff of Mediterranean brush. Linear and elegant, the medium-bodied palate features pomegranate, strawberry, white pepper and oak-driven spice alongside taut, refined tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paolo Calì 2017 Pruvenza Frappato (Vittoria)

Description: This brawny red has aromas of baked plum, warm spice and menthol. On the densely concentrated, chewy palate, velvety tannins envelop raspberry jam, candied cherry, espresso and vanilla. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Morgante 2017 Don Antonio Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling from the cool-climate Regan Vineyard near Watsonville is a unique take on this grape. Aromas of dark berry, violets, pencil shavings and damp wood lead into an earthy palate of iodine and rust. There are also flavors of black plums, elderberry and dried flowers on the wine, which is starting to show its age but should remain interesting for many years.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Woodside 2013 Auto Vino Dolcetto (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: Aromas of crushed Mediterranean herbs and a dash of Chinese five spice are in full force on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is equally savory and spicy, with tart blueberry and cherry tones filling it out. There's a slight earthy funk to the midpalate, akin to a brisk jaunt on a farm, with polished tannins and fresh acidity lending support to it all.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Statti 2015 Batasarro Riserva Gaglioppo (Lamezia)

Appellation: Cerasuolo di Vittoria Classico, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Enticing aromas of ripe black cherry, menthol and violet mingle with dark cherry on the nose of this smooth, focused red. The juicy, savory palate offers dark cherry, ground clove and a hint of coffee alongside supple tannins. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paolo Calì 2016 Violino  (Cerasuolo di Vittoria Classico)

Description: Aromas of brand-dipped cherries and plums seamlessly meld with anise, allspice and cigar spice in this densely packed red. Firmly medium in weight, there's richness to the berry and plum fruit on the palate but it's all wrapped in a firm mesh of polished tannin and bright acidity. A dark plum-skin tone lingers on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Filomusi Guelfi 2017  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: Balsamic aromas of crushed mint, camphor and star anise are front and center in this barrel-aged red. The aromas carry over to the firm palate along with dried black cherry and a hint of coffee bean. Taut, fine-grained tannins provide tight support. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Maccari 2017 Saia Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of fresh-pressed cherries and blackberries meld with accents of crushed herbs and sweet tobacco in this unoaked Montepulciano. Juicy mixed berries carry the fresh palate, with supple tannins and lifted acidity keeping everything in check. Cherry skins lend grip to the feel and linger on the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tenuta I Fauri 2018 Baldovino  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Bright and savory, this fragrant red has enticing aromas of wild red berry, rose and dark spice. On the lithe, juicy palate, supple tannins and fresh acidity accompany crushed strawberry and star anise. Drink through 2021.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Donnafugata 2018 Bell'Assai Frappato (Vittoria)

Description: A pleasing mix of wild cherry and blackberry melds with freshly chopped mint and alpine herbs on the nose. There's tension, grip and juiciness to the berry fruit on the palate, with smoothed tannins and fresh acidity lending support. A gentle tug of berry skins lingers on the close, making this a fresh, savory expression of the variety.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tiberio 2018  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: Dense aromas of brandy-soaked red cherry and plum meet a firm blend of sweet spice and crushed herbs on the nose. It's rounded in feel on the medium-bodied palate, showing a juicy mix of fresh cherry and plum fruit peppered with more sweet spices.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Contesa 2017  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: This Gaglioppo is rounded in feel, with full red cherry and dark plum flavors that seamlessly blend with savory tones of rosemary and hoisin. A tangy crushed stone element gives an energetic jolt to the palate, with medium-grained tannins lending support.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: I Greco 2016 Catà Gaglioppo (Calabria)

Description: A spicy, brambly nose gives way to depths of wild cherries and plums in this concrete fermented and aged red. The medium-bodied palate dabbles in juicy cherry and blackberry flavors accented by stemmy spice and purple flowers. A fine mesh of tannin lends tautness to the fruit, with bright acidity lifting up the whole experience.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Annona 2018 Modo Antico  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: There's surprising depth to this entry-level red, showing ripe red-cherry and blackberry tones studded with violet, tobacco and chopped mint. Suave tannins gracefully wrap around all that fruit, with fresh acidity lending ample support.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Azienda Agricola Monti 2015  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: Mouthwatering aromas of crushed, ripe strawberry and white pepper follow over to the tangy, savory palate along with a hint of orange zest. It's fresh and incredibly easy drinking, with lively acidity and pliant tannins. It closes on an almost salty note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gorghi Tondi 2019 Dumè Frappato (Sicilia)

Appellation: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane, Central Italy, Italy
Description: There's a finessed quality to the nose of this wine, showing violet and tobacco set against a red cherry backdrop. The smooth, supple palate is driven by tart black cherry, with lifted acidity lending support.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: De Angelis Corvi 2017 Fonte Raviliano  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)

Appellation: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane, Central Italy, Italy
Description: There's a finessed quality to the nose of this wine, showing violet and tobacco set against a red cherry backdrop. The smooth, supple palate is driven by tart black cherry, with lifted acidity lending support.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: De Angelis Corvi 2017 Fonte Raviliano  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)

Description: Aromas of French oak and eucalyptus mingle with whiffs of blue flower in this 100% Nerello Mascalese. The aromas carry over to the savory palate along with fleshy black cherry, prune star anise and carob. Close-grained tannins leave a dusty, mouthdrying close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Donnafugata 2017 Sul Vulcano Rosso  (Etna)

Description: This lavish red is all about rich fruit and warm spices. A dense core of brandy-soaked cherry is studded with allspice, cinnamon and clove, framed by a firm, rigid tannic structure that allows all that richness to expand. There's plenty of driving acidity to lend some balance, but ultimately this remains brooding and grippy, needing a hearty protein as a match.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Talamonti 2017 Tre Saggi  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, toasted nut and a whiff of eucalyptus follow over to the medium-palate along with juicy Marasa cherry. Taut, polished tannins provide lithe support. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2018 Tenuta Regaleali Lamùri Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Brandy-dipped cherries and blackberries meld with scrubby alpine herbs on the nose of this single-vineyard Montepulciano sourced from a mountainous estate. The palate is smooth and polished, driven by sour cherry and tart blackberry flavors that end crisp and bright. It's less concentrated and intense than previous vintages, but it still holds lots of enjoyment.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Valle Reale 2013 Vigneto di Popoli  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of blackberry jam, botanical herb and violet carry to the medium-bodied palate along with white pepper and bitter almond. Dusty tannins provide light support.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cusumano 2019 Tenuta San Giacomo Disueri Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This savory red has inviting aromas of ripe berry, eucalyptus and dark spice. On the medium-bodied, accessible palate, polished tannins accompany juicy Morello cherry, prune and cinnamon notes. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Rapitalà 2017 Alto Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Inviting aromas of baked plum, blue flower and eucalyptus mingle together in this polished red. On the savory, accessible palate, lithe tannins accompany juicy red plum, blackberry and hints of baking spice. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenute Orestiadi 2018 Perricone (Sicilia)

Description: Allspice, anise and clove are blended into the rich dark-cherry and black-plum core of this sultry red. It's luscious and enveloping in berry fruit on the palate, with warm spice and supple tannins framing it all.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Torre Zambra 2018  Villamagna

Description: Made with Nero d'Avola and aged in barrique, this has aromas of toasted oak, black-skinned berry, eucalyptus and a whiff of violet. The lean, linear palate offers dried black cherry, prune, hazelnut and a sprinkling of cocoa. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Arancio 2015 Riserva Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Smooth and juicy, this opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, violet and baking spice. The aromas carry over to the savory palate, along with spiced blueberry and white pepper. Rounded tannins and fresh acidity provide the easygoing framework. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fondo Antico 2018 Nenè Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of blue flower, black-skinned berry and a whiff of new leather form the inviting nose. Smooth and juicy, the palate offers blackberry jam, ripe black cherry and a hint of baking spice alongside soft, supple tannins. It's made to be enjoyed young, so drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2018 La Segreta Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of brandy-dipped cherries, wet tobacco and warm spices carry the well-concentrated nose. Smooth tannins and fresh acidity lend ample support to the rich cherry fruit on the palate, with warm spices lingering on the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Illuminati 2018 Lumeggio  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Ripe tones of blueberry and pomegranate form the nose and carry to the medium-bodied palate. Smoothed tannins and well-balanced acidity lend a solid frame for the tart fruit to hold court.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Librandi 2015 Duca Sanfelice Superiore Riserva  (Cirò Classico)

Description: Slightly charred warm spices blend into ripe cherry and black plum aromas on the nose. This is pleasantly balanced on the medium-bodied palate, showing ripe berry and plum flavors framed by a fine mesh of tannins and fresh acidity. Toasty spice rises up on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina Tollo 2016 Collesecco Rubi  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Well-concentrated aromas of baked cherry and black plum blend with wild mint and stemmy spice on the nose. There's richness and density to the medium-bodied palate, displaying thick black plum wrapped in a pillowy gauze of tannin. There's suppleness to the feel, with a grip of tannins marking the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tenuta I Fauri 2018 Ottobre Rosso  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Made with Nero d'Avola, this bright rosato has delicate aromas recalling wild red berry, spring wild flower and white peach. The tangy palate doles out juicy cherry, pink grapefruit, cinnamon and a hint of saline before a crisp, clean finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Morgante 2019 Rosé di Morgante Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Ripe tones of blueberry and cherry meld with a mix of herbal spice on the nose. The plush, fruity palate is filled out by fleshy berry flavors, with juicy acidity and polished tannins framing it all. While not overly complex, it's a well-balanced offering that will appease those looking for a solid middle-of-the-week pour.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Statti 2018 Gaglioppo (Calabria)

Description: Ripe tones of blueberry and cherry meld with a mix of herbal spice on the nose. The plush, fruity palate is filled out by fleshy berry flavors, with juicy acidity and polished tannins framing it all. While not overly complex, it's a well-balanced offering that will appease those looking for a solid middle-of-the-week pour.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Statti 2018 Gaglioppo (Calabria)

Description: Made with native grape Corinto, this opens with aromas of French oak, coconut, underbrush, vanilla and prune. The aromas carry over to the smooth palate along with a coffee bean note. Polished tannins lend light support. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Castellaro 2018 Corinto Nero (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Bright aromas of cherry and blackberry meld with menthol and tobacco on the nose. Tart berry fruit drives the light-bodied palate, with a fine-mesh tannic grip and fresh acidity pushing it along.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Torre Raone 2017 Lucanto  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of cassis, French oak, toasted nut and eucalyptus form the nose. The palate reflects the heat of the vintage, offering dried cherry, prune, powdered sage and coconut alongside close-grained tannins that leave a rather astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2014 Tanè Nero d'Avola (Vittoria)

Description: Made with organically farmed Nero d'Avola, this vegan friendly, easygoing red has inviting aromas of black-skinned berry, botanical herb and baking spice. Soft, savory and enjoyable, the palate offers ripe blackberry, fleshy black cherry and cinnamon framed in pliant tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Colosi 2018 Ecolosi Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Quiet aromas of crushed herbs and brandy-dipped cherries grace the nose of this unoaked Montepulciano. There's a silkiness to cherry fruit on the palate, with well-mannered tannins and bright acidity lifting it all up. It's a solid entry-level offering to enjoy with pizza or pasta.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Nicodemi 2018 Terrana  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Smooth and juicy, this opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, violet and camphor. The solid palate offers prune, dried cherry and star anise alongside taut, rather drying tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Morgante 2017 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, blue flower and menthol form the nose. On the chewy palate, polished tannins gently support juicy black cherry, blackberry and star anise while fresh acidity keeps bright. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cortese 2018 Senia Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Appellation: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Densely packed aromas of brandy-soaked plum and cherry meet toasted spice and iodine in this brooding red. It's full and hefty in feel, built by a thick coating of medium-grained tannins that lend grip and grit to all that plummy fruit. There is some balance to be enjoyed, thanks to a lifted vein of fresh acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: De Angelis Corvi 2015 Elévito Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)

Description: Black-skinned berry, blue flower and dark spice aromas form the nose. On the supple, enjoyable palate, round tannins gently support wild blueberry, crushed blackberry and a hint of cinnamon. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Maccari 2018 Nerè Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of forest berry, eucalyptus and Mediterranean herb form the nose. Made with organically farmed grapes, the easygoing palate offers ripe black cherry, vanilla and a hint of bitter almond alongside pliant tannins. Drink through 2021.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gorghi Tondi 2018 Coste a Preola Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Rather reserved on the nose, aromas of mentholated herbs and red cherry eventually arise. The medium-bodied palate shows tense red-berry fruit against accents of crushed black pepper and Mediterranean herbs. Fresh acidity maintains balance, with a firm webbing of close-knit tannins wrapping it all up. It ends with some grit and grip, but pair with a hearty protein and this wine will sing.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Ippolito 1845 2017 Liber Pater Superiore  (Cirò Classico)

Description: This plush, rounded riserva offers rich tones of black cherry and plum wrapped in clove, allspice and cigar wrapper accents. The tannins are smooth yet coating, enveloping all that fruit. Bright acidity lends the needed support to make this a blunt yet enjoyable sip.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina Tollo 2016 Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Made with organic grapes, this has aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, new leather and crushed Mediterranean herb. On the medium-bodied palate, polished tannins accompany ripe Marasca cherry, star anise and a hint of carob. Bright acidity keeps it fresh. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Caruso & Minini 2019 Naturalmente Bio Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Enjoyable for its straightfoward appeal, this organic Montepulciano shows vinous blackberry and cherry flavors framed in stemmy spice. Medium-grained tannins and fresh acidity lend support, making this a well-balanced, easy-to-like offering.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Feudo Antico 2018 Organic  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of ripe plum and baking spice follow over to the soft, easygoing palate along with notes of carob and black cherry. Supple tannins offer gentle support. Drink now.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Arancio 2019 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of French oak, menthol and prune carry over to the palate along with hints of roasted coffee bean and licorice. Grainy tannins clench the astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Funaro 2017 Ominis Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made with slightly dried grapes, this solid red has aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, blue flower and a hint of dark spice. Reflecting the nose, the medium-bodied, no-frills palate shows fleshy black cherry and a hint of cocoa alongside relaxed tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantine Ermes 2018 Quattro Quarti Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This has pretty aromas of fragrant purple flower and ripe dark-skinned berry. On the easygoing palate, soft tannins accompany blackberry jam and crushed Morello cherry. It's made to be enjoyed young, so drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2019 Bellifolli Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Blue flower, eucalyptus and blackberry jam aromas form the nose. On the medium-bodied palate, easygoing tannins accompany prune, dried cherry and a hint of coffee bean. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Principi di Butera 2016 Amira Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned fruit and eucalyptus follow over to the taut palate along with suggestions of coconut and espresso. It has bright acidity while dusty tannins leave a drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sallier de la Tour 2018 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made with organically grown grapes, this lively red has aromas and flavors of sour cherry, fresh strawberry and a hint of white pepper. It's bright and easygoing, with crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2019 Il Frappato (Sicilia)

Description: Blackberry jam, orange zest and baking spice aromas carry over to the straightforward palate along with a hint of carob. Pliant tannins offer light support. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Colosi 2019 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, menthol and ripe black-skinned berry form the nose. On the easygoing palate, bright acidity and pliant tannins offer minimal support for prune, dried cherry and a hint of carob. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Alessandro di Camporeale 2018 Donnatà Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Appellation: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Crushed blackberry and dark cherry aromas carry a slight jellied note on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is driven by juicy acidity, with a firm mesh of tannin lending support. This ends fruity and lifted on a cherry skin note.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Nicodemi 2017 Le Murate  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Bright aromas of red cherry and currant jam meld with a hefty streak of violet on the nose. The palate is light in feel, driven by spritely flavors of tart red fruit that carries a slightly jammy quality. A fine mesh of tannins lends support to the midpalate and builds on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Ognissole 2017 Romanico Nero di Troia (Castel del Monte)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this has aromas of baked plum, vanilla and a whiff of blue flower. Reflecting the nose, the medium-bodied palate offers prune and baking spice alongside dusty, drying tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ottoventi 2017 Nerello Mascalese (Sicilia)

Description: Bright, fruity aromas of cherry and raspberry carry the straightforward nose. It's light in feel on the palate and equally fruit-driven, with juicy acidity and slightly sandy tannins cinching it up. It's a well-balanced, accessible red.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Librandi 2018 Rosso Classico  (Cirò)

Description: Bright and juicy, this easygoing red has aromas of black-skinned berry, carob and a hint of baking spice. The aromas follow over to the soft, accessible palate alongside pliant tannins. Drink now.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Stemmari 2019 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Ripe cherry and raspberry-jam aromas are clean and lifted on the nose, with warm spices chiming in. This is light and juicy in feel, offering tasty red fruit alongside vanilla and anise. It's simple and straightforward, but many will find enjoyment in its mix of fruit and sweet spices.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Talamonti 2019 Modà  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of crushed mint, toasted oak, ripe black-skinned berry and blue flower lead the nose. The no-frills palate offers fleshy Morello cherry, roasted coffee bean and a hint vanilla alongside relaxed tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenute Orestiadi 2018 Frappato (Sicilia)

Description: There's a sharpness to the aromas of wild mint, thyme and red cherry on the nose. The palate is rather thick in feel, with tart cherry and blackberry flavors that are wrapped up in a wooly blanket of tannin. Bright acidity does shine through to help enliven the experience.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cirelli la Collina Biologica 2018  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: Brambly aromas of wild cherry and blackberry blend with a bit of wet tobacco on the nose of this fresh, lively red. Light in profile, it offers juicy red fruit on the palate framed by a delicate mesh of tannin and lifted by bright acidity. It's a well-priced, everyday red that would be a welcome addition to the dinner table.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Masciarelli 2017  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: There's purity and richness to the cherry and plum fruit on the nose of this bottling. Rounded red fruit carries the medium-bodied palate, with gentle accents of toasted vanilla and anise. Juicy acidity lifts it all up, while mellow tannins ride in the background. This is fresh, forward and easy to like.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Platinum Italia 2017 Sogno  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Fresh and easygoing, this enjoyable red has aromas and flavors of black plum, ripe black berry and a hint of vanilla. Soft tannins provide light support. Drink now.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Rapitalà 2018 Campo Reale Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of cooked down cherry and red plum carry a strong hoisin note on the nose. The palate is tangy and energetic, with broad swathes of tannins filling it out. There's a pleasing juiciness to the red fruit, as well as savory herbs chiming in, but the tannins are drying and cinching on the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Ippolito 1845 2015 Colli del Mancuso Superiore Riserva  (Cirò Classico)

Description: Aromas of anise, wood grain and vanilla are front and center in this riserva. Baked raspberry and cherry flavors carry the medium-bodied palate, with bright enough acidity to lend support. It ends on more sweet spice tones, but they mesh decently well with lingering fruit.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Paride d'Angelo 2016 Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of camphor, blue flower and crushed blackberry lead the nose. On the lean, straightforward palate, taut tannins accompany dried cherry and a hint of baking spice.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2017 Il Moro Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made with organically grown grapes, this simple red has aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit and a whiff of blue flower. It's easygoing, offering fleshy blackberry and spiced blueberry cushioned in pliant tannins. Drink now.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Funaro 2019 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made with slightly dried grapes, this easygoing red has subtle aromas of menthol, ripe plum and blue flower. The accessible palate doles out fleshy black cherry, raisin and vanilla alongside soft tannins. Drink now.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Curatolo Arini 1875 2019 Corto di Passo Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of French oak, nail polish remover and stewed prune carry over to the evolved palate along with orange rind and the barest hint of star anise. Grainy tannins leave an abrupt, drying close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Baglio di Pianetto 2014 Cembali Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: A mild nose of red cherry and mentholated herbs starts off this light-bodied red. Sour cherry and tart blackberry flavors are the main drivers on the palate, with slightly grainy yet delicate tannins lending support while letting the fruit shine.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina Tollo 2019 Biologico  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Straightforward aromas of cherry and red plum meld with warm spice and tobacco on the nose. Light in profile, this juicy, easygoing red has a mild grip of tannins holding it all together.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: La Fiera 2018  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: Perfectly pleasant and light on its feet, this informal red has aromas and flavors of strawberry and smoke that follow over to the rather diluted, pliant palate. Crisp acidity keeps it bright and tangy. Drink now.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Centonze 2018 Frappato (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Soft and easygoing, this informal red has pretty aromas of ripe black-skinned berry and a hint of baking spice. Made with organically grown grapes, the simple, juicy palate offers fleshy black berry and spiced blueberry alongside pliant tannins. Drink now.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantine Ermes 2019 Vento di Mare Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Reserved aromas of tar, black plum and tobacco slowly emerge from the glass. Medium in weight, the palate shows flavors of thickened black fruit wrapped in a layer of tannins. Bright acidity kicks in to lend some balance.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Casa Catelli 2018 Made with Organic Grapes  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: This simple but well made red offers aromas and flavors of ripe black cherry and hints of dark spice. It's fresh and soft, with pliant tannins offering support. Drink now.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cusumano 2019 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of cherry coulis, vanilla and cigar spice are decently concentrated on the nose. The light-bodied palate shows ripe berry fruit wrapped in a blanket of sweet spice. There's a decent balance to it all, with gentle tannins lending grip and fresh acidity driving it along.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina Valle Tritana 2017  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: This bouncy, fruity red is driven by tones of cigar box, anise and allspice that stick out from the red cherry core. There's a pleasing suppleness to the feel, with the fruit and spice elements finding a bit of cohesion on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Caldora 2017 Yume  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of violet and mulberry are front and center in this informal red. On the simple palate, drying tannins accompany fleshy blackberry, botanical herb and a hint of iron.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fina 2018 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Simple but well made, this easygoing red has aromas of ripe blackberry, juicy plum and baking spice. The aromas carry on to the fleshy, light-bodied palate along with soft tannins. Drink now.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Tonino 2018 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made with late harvested grapes, this has a shy nose while the dense palate doles out prune, vanilla and rusty iron alongside suggestions of sweet and sour sauce. It's solid, simple and fleeting.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ottoventi 2018 Ikuka Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This medium-bodied red is driven by tart cherry and blackberry flavors, with an earthy, floral tone akin to geranium riding in the background. The tannins lend a bit of grip to the midpalate and cinch up the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Paride d'Angelo 2019  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: This medium-bodied, straightforward red offers tones of sour cherry and grape jelly, with a hint of tobacco adding some nuance. It's decently balanced by bright acidity, with gentle tannins lending little support.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Spinelli 2019 Estate Bottled  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Baked raspberry and blackberry aromas carry a hefty dose of sweet spice on the nose. The light and easygoing berry fruit on the palate is wrapped in synthetic tones of vanilla, anise and wood grain.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Jasci & Marchesani 2018 Nerubè Biologico  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Made with dried grapes, this informal red has flavors recalling fleshy black-skinned berry and the barest hint of baking spice. Loose, soft tannins offer pliant support. Drink now.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nero Oro 2019 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Reduced upon opening, this starts off with a stewed cabbage tone that eventually dissipates to reveal the fruit that lies beneath. The light-bodied palate offers flavors of fresh cherry and blackberry framed by delicate, polished tannins and juicy acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Varvaglione 2017 12 e Mezzo Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: Densely concentrated, this has aromas of used leather, camphor and stewed prune. Reflecting the nose, the brawny, one-dimensional palate offers prune, candied raisin and vanilla alongside pliant tannins. You'll also detect the heat of alcohol on the bitter close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ottoventi 2018 .20 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of cherry syrup, peanut shell and mentholated tobacco are forward on the nose. Tart yet syrupy berry flavors follow on the palate, framed by coating tannins that clench the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Jasci & Marchesani 2019 Biologico  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: This has aromas recalling stewed prune, moist earth and a whiff of violet. The palate is extremely simple and rather diluted, offering mere suggestions of raisin and a hint of spice alongside grainy, fleeting tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi del Pisciotto 2018 Baglio del Sole Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This informal red has a shy nose while the light-bodied palate offers suggestions of prune and a hint of fleshy berry. It's extremely simple, with relaxed tannins lending some support.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Curatolo Arini 1875 2018 Paccamora Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Sweet aromas of vanilla, red cherry jam and pie crust carry an almost synthetic edge on the nose. This is rich and full on the palate, with chewy flavors of baked red plum doused in cinnamon, allspice and wood grain.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Jasci & Marchesani 2016 Janù Biologico  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: This extremely simple red has a shy nose while the diluted palate suggests cherry extract and a hint of saline. Dusty tannins give it an abrupt, mouthdrying close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: LaMura 2019 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This informal red has subtle aromas suggesting prune and used leather that follow over to the extremely simple palate. It's light in feel, with loose tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Caleo 2019 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This informal red has a shy nose while the diluted palate offers the merest suggestions of red berry. It's extremely simple, with loose, fleeting tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: TerrAmore 2019 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This rustic red has aromas suggesting horse stall, damp underbrush and a whiff of overripe black-skinned fruit. The aromas follow over to the muddled, bitter palate alongside grainy tannins and brisk acidity before an abrupt, mouthdrying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi del Pisciotto 2018 Versace Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Extremely simple, this fleeting red has muddled aromas and flavors suggesting prune, eucalyptus oil and hints of lead pencil. It's rather rustic and slightly fizzy, with a drying close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ottoventi 2018 Wow Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Smoke, star anise, mature wild berry, Mediterranean scrub and blue flower are just some of the aromas you'll find on this compelling red. Elegant, structured and incredibly delicious, the smooth, focused palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, rhubarb, licorice and tobacco alongside a vein of flinty mineral. It's impeccably balanced, with polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Graci 2015 Arcuria Sopra il Pozzo Rosso  (Etna)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made by carrying out the second fermentation in the bottle, this radiant, lightly sparkling wine opens with heady aromas of citrus, violet and a yeasty whiff of bread dough. Bone-dry and delicious, the energized palate delivers tart sour cherry, juicy pomegranate, pink grapefruit and white pepper alongside crisp acidity and a savory hint of saline. One bottle probably won't be enough.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paltrinieri 2019 Radice  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Absolutely delicious, this elegant, fragrant wine offers enticing aromas of violet, red berry, citrus and baking spice. The bone-dry, foaming palate delivers strawberry, raspberry and red cherry, accented with cinnamon and ginger notes. Crisp acidity gives it a pristine, quenching finish that leaves you wanting more.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paltrinieri 2019 Leclisse  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Description: Wild-berry, blue-flower, Mediterranean brush and exotic spice aromas shape the expressive nose. Smooth and vibrant, the delicious palate doles out juicy black cherry, blackberry, spiced blueberry and tobacco cushioned in velvety, enveloping tannins. It's well balanced, with fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2016 Santa Cecilia Nero d'Avola (Noto)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The essence of stone is throughout this bottling of a grape originally from Umbria, Italy. Aromas of river stone, granite and gravel meet with red currant and underripe strawberry. The palate is brisk in acidity and mineral-driven, while taut tannins carry bright red-fruit flavors into a dry finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Harrington 2018 Calleri Vineyard Sagrantino (San Benito County)

Description: Elegant and savory, this focused red has aromas of wild berry, blue flower, underbrush and dark spice. The radiant palate has great energy, delivering juicy Morello cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside lithe, fine-grained tannins that give it a rather drying finish. Bright acidity keeps it well balanced. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Alta Mora 2016 Feudo di Mezzo Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of fragrant purple flower, underbrush, Mediterranean scrub and fragrant spice shape the nose. Focused and elegantly structured, the vibrant palate features ripe black cherry, raspberry, licorice and a hint of saline alongside tightly wound, fine-grained tannins that grip the close. Drink 2022–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Alta Mora 2016 Guardiola Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Made from the rare native grape Sirica, this offers enticing aromas of fragrant purple flower, black-skinned berry and Mediterranean brush. The balanced, succulent palate features blackberry, clove, tobacco and black pepper alongside velvety tannins and bright acidity. Enjoy through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2018 Sirica (Campania)

Description: This stand-out Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo starts off with an engaging nose of fresh-pressed cherry, lemon oil and crushed herbs on the nose. An earthy, brambly base note underpins it all. There's weight, presence and grip to the palate, driven by pulsing flavors of Morello cherry and red currant. Gentle tones of rooibos and crushed stone add depth and lift to this textural beauty. Drink now–2022.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Amorotti 2017  Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lush and jammy while expertly ripe aromas of black cherry and boysenberry meet with vanilla and baking spice on the nose of this fresh and fun wine. The grape hails from the cooler spots of northeastern Italy, which fits the Edna Valley, producing a palate of smooth tannins, blackberry-pie flavors and spice accents of star anise and mace.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wolff 2018 Teroldego (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of strawberries, rose petals and a whiff of brioche follow over to the tangy, savory palate along with orange rind and sour cherry. Bright acidity and an elegant, lively perlage provide the energized setting.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Medici Ermete 2018 Metodo Classico Carezza  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of strawberries, rose petals and a whiff of brioche follow over to the tangy, savory palate along with orange rind and sour cherry. Bright acidity and an elegant, lively perlage provide the energized setting.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Medici Ermete 2018 Metodo Classico Carezza  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Description: Elegant and focused, this lithe red offers aromas of fragrant blue flower, wild red berry and Mediterranean scrub. Made from vineyards overlooking the sea, the savory, ethereal palate delivers juicy strawberry, sour cherry, star anise and a saline note alongside glossy tannins. Vibrant acidity adds even more energy to the mineral tension.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2018 Nocera (Sicilia)

Description: This textural pink wine was fermented with indigenous yeast in amphora, giving it a bit of a wild edge. Concentrated aromas of dark cherry and blackberry meld with accents of rooibos and crushed stone on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is rounded yet energized, with no harsh edges. Detailed tones of wild berries are lifted by persistent acidity and framed by crunchy tannins. It's a delicious pink wine to enjoy in the cooler months of the year. Drink now–2022.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Francesco Cirelli 2017  Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Bread-crust, strawberry, vanilla and orange-rind aromas escape the glass. The aromas carry over to the elegant palate along with pink grapefruit and star anise set against tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paltrinieri 2019 Grosso Metodo Classico  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Initial tones of coconut, anise and cola carry the nose, with dense blackberry and black cherry aromas eventually chiming in. It's full and rich on the palate, oozing with seductive warm spice tones and gripping dark fruit, all while polished tannins and well-integrated acidity lend to the ample structure. It's surly in its infancy, needing time to stitch together. Drink 2023–2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tormaresca 2016 Bocca di Lupo Aglianico (Castel del Monte)

Description: Savory and mineral-driven, this opens with aromas of smoke, mature dark-skinned fruit, underbrush and camphor. The medium-bodied palate features concentrated flavors of black cherry, raspberry jam, licorice and a sprinkling of cinnamon framed in fine-grained, rather drying tannins before a flinty close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ampelon 2017 Passo delle Sciare Rosso  (Etna)

Description: This racy red opens with aromas of wet stone, wild aromatic herb, violet and ground clove. It's exquisite and has intense energy, featuring juicy pomegranate, orange zest, star anise and savory saline alongside firm acidity and taut, polished tannins. Some may find this too ethereally delicate, but lovers of extreme elegance will be hooked.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pietradolce 2018 Contrada Santo Spirito Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Delicately scented, this offers light aromas of spring wild flower, crushed thyme and wild berry. Bone-dry but loaded with flavor, the savory palate delivers cranberry, pomegranate, citrus and bread crust before a grilled rosemary finish. Crisp acidity and a refined perlage provide the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Dubl NV Rosato Dosaggio Zero Aglianico (Vino Spumante)

Description: This richly hued pink wine starts off with a nose of freshly pressed cherries and blackberries—stems and all. While the fruit is intense and concentrated, there are earthy base notes of herbs and bramble that tie it all together. It's full, yet fresh on the palate, showing amazing purity to the berry-fruit flavors. Slicks of crushed stone and herbs keep this lifted and energized. It's an excellent offering from an estate winery located in the Pescara province of Abruzzo. Drink now–2021.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tiberio 2019  Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, cooking spice and grilled herb emerge from the glass. The enveloping palate doles out juicy blueberry, star anise, almond and black pepper alongside velvety tannins and bright acidity. Enjoy through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Elvio Cogno 2018 Mandorlo  (Dolcetto d'Alba)

Description: Elegant and savory, this Nerello Mascalese opens with heady aromas of wild red berry, blue flower, wet stone, toasted nut and botanical herb. The linear, focused palate offers sour cherry, orange zest, star anise and espresso alongside lithe, fine-grained tannins. Bright acidity keeps it balanced.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gambino 2016 Petto Dragone Rosso  (Etna)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Dry and tangy, this sparkler has aromas of violet, red berry, grapefruit and a whiff of baking spice. Reflecting the nose, the savory, quenching palate doles out juicy sour cherry, strawberry and white pepper, alongside a foamy mousse and crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa di Corlo 2019 Primevo  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of violet, botanical herb and whiffs of walnut form the nose. It's bright and savory, featuring juicy pomegranate, pink grapefruit and a hint of spice alongside a refined perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paltrinieri 2018 La Riserva  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Refermented in the bottle, this savory sparkler has aromas of grapefruit, rose and red berry. The lightly sparkling palate doles out juicy red cherry, citrus, yeasty whiffs of bread dough and white pepper alongside tangy acidity. It has a crisp, mouthwatering close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Soliera NV Il Trovador  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Description: Pretty closed upon opening, this needs some time to stitch together, so decant or enjoy leisurely over a long meal. Tight aromas of pomegranate, coriander seed and red currant slowly unfurl on the nose. The medium-bodied palate displays a mix of textures and flavors, from smooth raspberry and racy pomegranate, to powdered white pepper and slick wet stones. The alcohol shows its face a bit, but it's well compensated for by the detail of flavor and texture.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Valentini 2018  Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Italian grapes seem to thrive in this warmer region, as evidenced in this bottling's aromas of red currant, rose petals, wet stone and sandalwood. Baked cranberry and raspberry meet with cigar-box elements and peppery spice on the palate, which is fresh and light.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Europa Village 2017 Vienza Montepulciano (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
