Description: Refermented in the bottle, this lightly sparkling wine has aromas of red berry, violet, citrus and yeasty whiffs of bread dough. Mirroring the nose, the dry, tangy palate doles out juicy raspberry, grapefruit and a hint of ginger alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Medici Ermete 2019 Phermento Frizzante  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Fun and refreshing, this dry, lightly sparkling wine presents juicy strawberry, raspberry and orange rind accented by a hint of white pepper. Made with 70% Lambrusco di Sorbara and 30% Lambrusco di Salamino, it's crisp and savory, with ultrafine bubbles.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paltrinieri 2019 Piria  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Description: This rich wine is an excellent example of the Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo style. It's rounded and ripe in a red-cherry flavor, with a textural, gripping mouthfeel that's cleaned up by tangy acidity and crushed stone. It's a wine to enjoy year-round, but could be a great choice as a wintertime rosato. Drink through 2021.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Illuminati 2019 Lumeggio di Rosa  (Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo)

Description: This vibrantly hued cherry-red Cerasuolo kicks off with brisk aromas of red-apple peel and Morello cherry, underpinned by a soft washed cheese-rind note. The palate is rounded and well integrated, echoing the fruit tones of the nose and lifted by tangy crushed stone. A bit tightly coiled now, this will be an enjoyable pour in the winter and spring months of 2021.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Masciarelli 2019 Villa Gemma Superiore  (Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo)

Description: Pretty aromas of violet, raspberry and blackberry carry to the light, fresh palate. This shows juicy fruit flavors struck against a solid structure, making this a great red to enjoy as the weather turns slightly cooler.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Masseria Li Veli 2018 Askos Susumaniello (Salento)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Offering a pleasing mix of sweet and savory tones on the nose, this red delves into aromas of black plum, baked ham, anise and peppery spice. The medium-bodied palate is rounded in feel, built by a firm grip of tannins but filled out by rich flavors cherry and plum.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Crifo 2015 Augustale Riserva Nero di Troia (Castel del Monte)

Description: Aromas of rose, exotic spice and wild berry shape the nose on this fragrant red, along with whiffs of moist earth and leather. The linear, vibrant palate features Marasca cherry, licorice and a hint of espresso alongside racy acidity and close-grained tannins that leave a drying finish. Drink 2022–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pietradolce 2018 Contrada Rampante Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of violet, black-skinned berry and spice emerge from the glass. The vibrant, mouthwatering palate delivers crushed blueberry, ground pepper and clove alongside polished tannins. An almond note marks the finish. Enjoy through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Neive 2016 Vigna Basarin  (Dolcetto d'Alba)

Description: Rich aromas of juicy red cherry and cranberry carry meld with an accent of balsamic-dripped herbs. Medium to full in feel, the palate is broad yet tangy, honed by impressions of crushed stone and red-berry skins. It's a fun wine to geek out over, especially for it's texture. Drink in the near term.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cirelli la Collina Biologica 2018  Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo

Description: Opaque ruby in color, this red starts off with quiet aromas of black grape and iodine, but becomes more expressive in a ground coffee tone as it sits. It's smooth and rich in feel, filled out by thick-skinned dark-berry and plum flavors framed by peppery tannins and balanced acidity. It's a bold, gripping red that would do well beside a hearty protein.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tagaro 2015 U'Cucci Susumaniello (Valle d'Itria)

Description: A bit closed upon opening, after time this offers a pretty nose of juiced raspberry and cranberry, with orchard blossoms chiming in. A gentle, tannic grip on the palate comes off like red-apple peel and cranberry skins, while a fresh, lifted tone of river rocks gives this pink wine vitality. Enjoy with a bit of a decant alongside poultry and veggie roasts on a crisp autumn evening. Drink through 2021.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Annona 2018  Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo

Description: Perfumed aromas of apple blossom and cherry carry the delightfully floral nose. The palate is smooth and inviting, offering a tasty mix of apple peel and tangy raspberry flavors. A bit of cherry-cocktail bitters adds some grip, but integrates nicely into the fruit. Drink through 2021.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina Tollo 2019 Hedòs  (Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of crushed limestone, red-cherry skin and blood-orange rind make an engaging, fresh start to this pink wine made from organically grown Montepulciano. The medium-bodied palate boasts tart red-berry, orange and herbal spice notes that are wrapped in a gentle tannic frame. Drink through 2021.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cataldi Madonna 2019 Malandrino  (Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo)

Description: Made with Nerello Mascalese, this has aromas of scorched earth, camphor, French oak and exotic spice. The linear palate offers dried cherry, licorice, vanilla and roasted coffee bean alongside close-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Al-Cantàra 2017 O'Scuro O'Scuro Rosso  (Etna)

Description: There's a brambly, spicy edge to the enticing raspberry and blackberry aromas in this wine. The palate is plush and rounded, filled out by juicy berry flavors that are framed by gentle tannins and lifted acidity. This is a young, fresh, easygoing wine that will please many with its accessible style.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tenute Rubino 2018 Oltremé Susumaniello (Brindisi)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this medium-bodied red opens with aromas of red-skinned berry, violet and graphite. The juicy palate offers succulent red cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside polished tannins. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Rocca 2018 Rocca  (Dolcetto d'Alba)

Description: Rich red-cherry in color, this Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo is inviting in aromas of fresh-pressed Morello cherries, with flecks of warm spices and earthy rooibos. The medium-bodied palate is fleshy and rounded, driven by a tart cherry flavor and spritzy acidity. A persistent cocktail-bitters note arises on the midpalate and extends on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tenuta I Fauri 2019 Baldovino  (Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of toasted nut, scorched earth, leather and eucalyptus shape the nose. Full bodied and linear, the taut palate shows dried cherry, licorice, hazelnut and vanilla. Tightly knit, close-grained tannins leave an assertive, tongue drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cottanera 2017 Feudo di Mezzo Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Black-skinned berry, licorice and cooking-spice aromas form the nose on this approachable red. The velvety palate offers blackberry, star anise and white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Voerzio Martini 2018 Rocchettevino  (Dolcetto d'Alba)

Description: This entry-level Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo is a very good example of the style at an attractive price. A rounded palate boasts flavors of balsamic-dipped cherries and crushed limestone, with a gentle, gripping mouthfeel akin to freshly pressed cranberry juice. It ends brisk and tangy.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Illuminati 2019 Campirosa  (Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo)

Appellation: Vino Bianco d'Italia, Italy Other, Italy
Description: Made with 100% Nero d'Avola but vinified as a white wine, this bright offering opens with aromas of white stone fruit and honeysuckle. The fresh palate offers pink grapefruit, white almond and a saline finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Morgante 2019 Bianco di Morgante Nero d'Avola (Vino Bianco d'Italia)

Description: Fragrant blue-flower, dark-skinned berry and nutmeg aromas lift out of the glass. The fresh, savory palate offers black currant, clove and raw almond alongside polished tannins. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: G D Vajra 2018 Coste & Fossati  (Dolcetto d'Alba)

Description: Aromas of red-skinned berry and cooking spice lead the nose while the medium-bodied palate offers succulent strawberry, red cherry and hints of white pepper. Bright acidity and smooth tannins provide freshness and balance. For a perfect summer red, serve slightly chilled.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Braida di Giacomo Bologna 2019 Limonte  (Grignolino d'Asti)

Description: Aromas of red-skinned fruit, underbrush and aromatic herb emerge from the glass. The savory palate offers juicy strawberry, clove and star anise alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Monte Ilice 2017 Rosso  (Etna)

Appellation: Dolcetto di Diano d'Alba, Piedmont, Italy
Description: Violet, tilled soil and cooking-spice aromas lead the nose. The juicy palate offers black cherry, clove and bitter almond alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Giorgio Carnevale 2018  Dolcetto di Diano d'Alba

Description: This spicy red opens with aromas of clove, star anise, wild herb and exotic spice. The round palate is light on its feet, offering Marasca cherry, black pepper and a hint of blood orange. It's ready to enjoy, with lithe tannins and fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ioppa 2015 Mualetta Vespolina (Colline Novaresi)

Description: This rich, sultry red offers aromas of dark cocoa, toasted anise and chocolate-covered cherries that carry to the rounded palate. A bit of fiery Bourbon spice kicks in on the midpalate, but is tamed come the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Schola Sarmenti 2017 Antièri Susumaniello (Salento)

Description: Blue-flower, Mediterranean scrub and over-mature black-skinned-fruit aromas form the nose. The ripe palate is rather evolved, offering fleshy plum, spiced blue berry and a hint of cinnamon alongside dusty, drying tannins that leave a lean finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ampelon 2015 Le Caldere Rosso  (Etna)

Appellation: Dolcetto di Diano d'Alba, Piedmont, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of dark-skinned berry, tilled soil and a whiff of charcoal smoke. The savory palate offers blackberry, licorice and black pepper alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Giovanni Abrigo 2018 Garabei  (Dolcetto di Diano d'Alba)

Description: Aromas of forest floor, dark-skinned berry, toasted hazelnut and a potpourri of baking spice lead the nose. On the concentrated palate, a backbone of vigorous acidity accompanies dried Marasca cherry, black pepper, ground clove and minty notes alongside dusty tannins before a puckering, mouthdrying close. It's a bit rustic but has charm for sure. Drink after 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina Preziosa 2018 Vespolina (Coste della Sesia)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, licorice and baking spice shape the nose. The light-bodied palate offers black cherry, star anise and a touch of almond alongside pliant tannins. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Enrico Serafino 2019 Dosso  (Dolcetto d'Alba)

Description: Aromas of French oak dominate the nose while whiffs suggesting blue flower and wet stone stay in the background. Reflecting the nose, the medium-bodied palate offers coconut, espresso, vanilla and prune alongside assertive, drying tannins and racy acidity. It's more about oak-driven spice than Etna's classic fruit and mineral sensations.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monteleone 2018 Rumex Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, licorice and baking spice shape the nose. The light-bodied palate offers black cherry, star anise and a touch of almond alongside pliant tannins. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Enrico Serafino 2019 Dosso  (Dolcetto d'Alba)

Description: A relatively quiet nose of red-apple peel and crushed raspberry starts this off. The light-bodied palate is zesty in feel, driven by a tart red-cherry flavor that's held in check by a mild grip of tannins. Acidity is the main driver here, making this a bright, crisp offering to enjoy in the near term.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Il Feuduccio Di S. Maria D'Orni 2019  Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo
Winery: Il Feuduccio Di S. Maria D'Orni

Description: This opens with subdued aromas evoking baking spice and ripe black-skinned fruit. The straightforward palate offers dried black cherry, clove and hazelnut alongside relaxed tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Salvano 2017 Fosco  (Dolcetto d'Alba)

Description: Aromas of rubber, toasted anise and black raspberry carry the nose. The palate is fruity and forward, with slightly jammy flavors of blackberries and bursting plum. It's mellow and soft in feel, with plenty of acidity lending support.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tenute Rubino 2017 Oltremè Susumaniello (Salento)

Description: This has subdued aromas suggesting scorched earth, grilled porcini, violet and menthol. The palate opens with prune, licorice and roasted coffee bean before assertive, drying tannins generate an abrupt, astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Curatolo Arini 1875 2017 Rosso  (Etna)

Description: This has subdued aromas evoking red-skinned fruit and baking spice. The straightforward palate offers red plum and clove alongside rounded tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Massara Burlotto 2019  Dolcetto d'Alba

Appellation: Dolcetto di Diano d'Alba, Piedmont, Italy
Description: Subtle aromas suggesting blue flower and baking spice lead the nose. The easygoing palate offers cranberry and white pepper alongside lithe tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Giordano 2018 Sorì Costa Fiore  (Dolcetto di Diano d'Alba)

Description: Dense aromas of baked plum, fig and blackberry carry the rich nose. The palate is driven by jammy black-fruit flavors, with plenty of lifted acidity to keep it fresh. The tannins are firm and a bit sandy, but are a fine match for the rich fruit flavors.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Claudio Quarta 2017 Tenute Eméra Anima di Negroamaro (Lizzano)

Description: This simplistic red starts off with aromas of violet and black grape. Jammy fruit flavors are wrapped in firm acidity, with mellow tannins giving it a soft, rounded feel.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantine Menhir 2019 Pietra Susumaniello (Salento)

Description: This fresh, easygoing red is made entirely in stainless steel and meant to be enjoyed young. Brisk aromas of red plum and raspberry blend with tones of violet and peanut shell on the nose. The palate is bright and zesty in red-berry fruit, driven by a pulsing river of acidity and mellow tannins.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Apollonio 2019 Elfo Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: This rich wine gushes in tones of crushed black grapes, blackberry and violet. It's sultry and dense on the palate, offering gripping flavors of thick-skinned dark fruit framed by firm tannins and lifted acidity. It ends fiery hot and peppery, unable to tame the alcohol within.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tenute Rubino 2016 Torre Testa Susumaniello (Salento)

Description: This has subdued aromas of oak, toasted nut and coconut. The aromas follow over the lean, extracted palate along with espresso notes but it lacks fruit richness and vibrancy. Grainy, drying tannins leave a raspy finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cottanera 2015 Zottorinotto Riserva Rosso  (Etna)

Description: A straightforward nose of raspberry, cherry and tobacco carries the nose. The palate is light in feel, with clenching tannins drying up the red-fruit flavors. It ends superdry and gripping.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Amastuola 2016 Aglianico (Puglia)

Description: Fragrant and loaded with finesse, this gorgeous red stuns with captivating scents of pressed rose, violet, red berry, white pepper as well as whiffs of smoke and balsamic notes. Boasting extreme elegance and intensity, the smooth, delicious palate delivers strawberry jelly, raspberry compote, cinnamon and flinty mineral framed in smooth, silky tannins. Made from some of the highest vineyards on Mount Etna and 100-year-old vines, it's endowed with bright acidity that keeps it superbly balanced. Drink through 2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2018 Contrada R Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Intoxicatingly fragrant, this gorgeous wine opens with enticing scents of perfumed berry, new leather, aromatic Mediterranean herb, camphor and forest floor. Showing body and finesse, the savory, structured palate delivers morello cherry, ripe strawberry, orange zest and a hint of hazelnut alongside firm fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink through 2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2018 Contrada P Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made without using harsh chemicals and aged in Etna's traditional chestnut barrels, this compelling, fragrant red offers complex aromas of camphor, ripe forest berry, blue flower, sandalwood and earthy aromas of new leather and tilled soil. The smooth, delicious palate shows ethereal elegance and depth, delivering juicy black cherry, raspberry compote, cinnamon and licorice alongside silky smooth tannins. Bright acidity keeps it balanced while notes of wild herb and saline linger on the finish. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monterosso 2016 Carbonio16  (Etna)

Description: When grown with care and precision, Nerello Mascalese, like Nebbiolo, can make extraordinary wines even in a wet, challenging vintage like 2018 as this radiant, rounded red demonstrates. Made by one of the denomination's stellar estates, it teases with perfumes of blue flower, rose, chamomile, baking spice and Mediterranean scrub alongside eucalyptus notes. Savory and creamy, the palate doles out crushed strawberry, black cherry, sage and star anise alongside a hint of iron. Velvety tannins provide polished support. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2018 Contrada C Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Rose, underbrush and red-berry aromas shape the alluring nose along with whiffs of new leather and menthol. Smooth and delicious, the mouthwatering palate boasts a compelling combination of roundness, energy, depth and precision, delivering juicy red cherry, crushed raspberry, star anise and wild thyme. Racy acidity and elegant tannins lend balance and finesse while a tangy mineral note suggesting wet stone lingers on the close. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2018 Contrada G Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Velvety and delicious, this boasts inviting aromas of fragrant purple flower, ripe black-skinned fruit, leather, baking spice and balsamic notes of camphor. It's enveloping but also weightlessly elegant, delivering juicy Marasca cherry, raspberry jam, baking spice and tobacco alongside polished tannins. Fresh acidity and a flinty finish lend tension. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Graci 2016 Barbabecchi Quota Mille Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Lithe and fragrant, this graceful red has enticing scents of wild red berry, Mediterranean brush, rose and camphor. It's radiant, ethereally elegant and focused, delivering sour cherry, orange zest and star anise alongside vibrant acidity and refined tannins. Tangy mineral notes suggesting wet stone and oyster shell lend mineral tension. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2018 Contrada S Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Fresh and fruity, this Françoise Peschon-made wine sources from a site farmed by Peter Heitz, who himself is a winemaker at nearby Turnbull Cellars. Aromatic and fragrant in lavender, it bursts in acidity, providing a crispness to the otherwise soft supple palate. This is a fantastic place to start any inquiry into this grape's potential in California right now.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Matt Morris 2017 Shypoke Vineyard Charbono (Napa Valley)

Description: Morris teams up with winemaker Benoit Touquette and grower Vincent Tofanelli to make this stellar, memorable and complex red, spicy in candied strawberry, with mineral-like elements of iron and crushed rock. Seamless and powerful, it persists in black pepper on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Matt Morris 2016 Tofanelli Vineyard Charbono (Napa Valley)

Description: An obscure finding in the Napa Valley, vintner Matt Morris is devoted to this grape, making small-production versions from historic vineyards still hanging on and showing their worth. Here he works with Realm winemaker Benoit Touquette and adds just a bit of Malbec, concocting a wine that is juicy in plum, peach and blueberry. Softly textured and integrated in tannin, it finishes in a pleasing grit of dust.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Matt Morris 2016 Ode To Bonarda Charbono (Napa Valley)

Description: Fragrant and refined, this opens with aromas of wild rose, Mediterranean scrub, ripe woodland berry and a whiff of smoke. Elegant and linear, the palate offers juicy Marasca cherry, orange rind, baking spice and flinty mineral set against polished tannins. Tangy acidity provides energy. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Graci 2017  Etna

Description: Alpha could never be accused of making boring wines. This Aglianico gets the balance of quirk and class just right. It's a limpid, heady mélange of brambly berries, savory spice, sassafras, cola, tomato leaf and charred meat. In the mouth, there's a gentle tug of savory tannins on the plush fruit and those medicinal, secondary notes flow through to the finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Alpha Box & Dice 2017 Xola Aglianico (McLaren Vale)

Description: Aromas of woodland berry, Mediterranean scrub, camphor and oak-driven spice shape the nose on this fragrant red. On the tight palate, firm acidity accompanies raspberry jam, orange zest, vanilla and licorice. Firm, grainy tannins leave a puckering, drying close. Give the tannins a few years more years to relax a bit then drink.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pietradolce 2018 Archineri  (Etna)

Description: Rock star winemaker Françoise Peschon takes the reins here in Morris's Charbono-focused wine label. This vintage is juicy and dark in fruit, dust and rock. Cigar box with peppery seasonings, it has an earthy finishing touch of black licorice that intrigues.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Matt Morris 2017 Tofanelli Vineyard Charbono (Napa Valley)

Description: Heady aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, blue flower and Mediterranean scrub are front and center on this smooth red. Made with organically grown grapes, it's delicious and accessible, featuring blackberry jam, ripe black cherry, star anise and baking spice alongside supple tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it balanced. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Montoni 2019 Lagnusa Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Red berry, baking spice and a balsamic whiff of camphor lead the nose. On the racy, linear palate, firm acidity and polished tannins accompany sour cherry, orange zest, mineral and aniseed. Taut refined tannins balance the vibrant energy. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2018 Passopisciaro  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, Mediterranean herb, eucalyptus and red berry waft out of the glass. The bright medium-bodied palate features juicy morello cherry, raspberry, baking spice and a hint of hazelnut alongside fine-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cottanera 2018 Diciasettesalme  (Etna)

Description: Big and concentrated, this has aromas of mature black-skinned fruit, scorched soil and menthol. Reflecting the heat of the vintage, the brawny, chewy palate offers prune marinated in spirits, licorice and vanilla alongside close-grained tannins that leave a drying finish. You'll also notice the heat of evident alcohol. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pietradolce 2017 Barbagalli  (Etna)

Description: Lithe and racy, this has aromas of wild red berry, Mediterranean herb and a whiff of flint. Ethereally graceful, the linear palate shows sour cherry, fresh strawberry and white pepper alongside vibrant acidity and taut, rather drying tannins. A saline note marks the close. Drink 2021–2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pietradolce 2019  Etna

Description: This opens with aromas of prune and baking spice. The smooth approachable palate doles out ripe blackberry jam, licorice and vanilla alongside enveloping tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Montoni 2019 Core Perricone (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of French oak, coconut, blue flower and grilled herb mingle together in the glass. The medium-bodied is a bit lean on fruit richness, offering dried cherry, toasted hazelnut and a hint of espresso alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Massimo Lentsch 2017 Cosentino  (Etna)

Description: Made with 100% Nero d'Avola but vinified as a white wine, this bright wine offers aromas of white stone fruit and honeysuckle. The fresh palate features juicy pink grapefruit and white almond before a tangy saline finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Morgante 2019 Bianco di Morgante Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Earthy aromas of underbrush, scorched soil, mature dark-skinned berry and a whiff of game lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the smooth, lithe palate along with prune, star anise and balsamic notes of camphor. It's already accessible, with polished tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Massimo Lentsch 2017 San Teodoro  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of moist earth, Mediterranean scrub and wet stone waft out of the glass. It's racy and lean, offering raw cherry, coconut and a hint of coffee bean alongside brisk acidity and close-grained drying tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Benanti 2018 Contrada Monte Serra  (Etna)

Description: This opens with aromas of coconut, French oak and camphor. Mirroring the nose, the light-bodied, linear palate shows vanilla, oak-driven spice, dried cherry and espresso alongside fine-grained tannins that leave a drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gambino 2016 Tifeo  (Etna)

Description: Compelling aromas of Mediterranean scrub, fragrant purple flowers, wild berries and crushed stone lead the nose in this gorgeous red. On the delicious, elegantly structured palate, polished tannins seamlessly support flavors of juicy black cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and graphite all while fresh acidity keeps it balanced. Drink 2021–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tascante 2017 Contrada Sciaranuova  (Etna)

Description: Fragrant and refined, this offers enticing scents of woodland berries, rose petal, Mediterranean herbs and dark spice. Polished and delicious, the smooth, focused palate delivers juicy red cherry, white pepper and star anise alongside taut, smooth tannins and fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tascante 2017 Contrada Pianodario  (Etna)

Description: Aromas suggesting underbrush, wild red berries, cedar and Mediterranean scrub waft out of the glass. The polished, linear palate features juicy Marasca cherry, toasted hazelnut and star anise set against lithe tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tascante 2017 Contrada Rampante  (Etna)

Description: Delicate scents of woodland berries, cedar, blue flowers and wild herbs shape the nose. Made with 95% Nerello Mascalese and a dollop of Nerello Cappuccio, the linear, elegantly structured palate features ripe Morello cherry, blood orange, star anise and a hint of coffee bean alongside taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Torre Mora 2017 Chiuse Vidalba  (Etna)

Description: This racy sparkler offers aromas of white spring flowers and heady whiffs of Mediterranean scrub, pastry dough and orchard fruit. On the vibrant, savory palate, crisp acidity accompanies lychee, white peach and exotic spice alongside an elegant perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Metodo Classico Brut Sosta Tre Santi
Name: Nicosia 2016 Metodo Classico Brut Sosta Tre Santi Nerello Mascalese (Sicilia)

Description: Bright and savory, this has alluring scents of fragrant blue flowers, wild red berries and Mediterranean brush. On the polished, racy palate, supple tannins and vibrant acidity accompany juicy red cherry, blood orange, star anise and a tangy mineral note evoking rusty nail.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2019  Etna

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This iconic bottling of Nero di Troia is dense and intense on the nose in aromas of tobacco, cigar box and brandy soaked cherry and plum. It's fulled fleshed out and rounded on the palate, with smoothed polished tannins that frame deep tones of red-plum skin and cherry. Accents of crushed pepper and violet lift it up on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Rivera 2014 Puer Apuliae Riserva Nero di Troia (Castel del Monte)

Description: Aromas of toasted hazelnut, eucalyptus and violet lift out of the glass. Linear and elegant, the polished palate features Morello cherry, blackberry and hints of ground clove alongside lithe tannins and fresh acidity before a salty finish. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tascante 2018 Ghiaia Nera  (Etna)

Description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling shows black-currant and baked soil aromas on the nose. Dried earth, crushed rock and mushroom elements mix with black currant on the savory sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Robert Renzoni 2014 Vecchio Frate Lagrein (California)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Bright and snappy aromas of fresh raspberry gain complexity with hints of rainy gravel on the nose of this bottling. Cranberry and cherry flavors meet with dried thyme on the sip, which also possesses a fresh quality.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Robert Renzoni 2016 Montepulciano (Temecula Valley)

Description: Pastry dough, white stone fruit, wild herb and floral aromas mingle together on this enticing sparkler. Made with Nerello Mascalese, the creamy palate doles out white peach, lemon drop candy and a hint of saline alongside a foaming perlage. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Metodo Classico Gaudensius Blanc de Noir
Name: Firriato NV Metodo Classico Gaudensius Blanc de Noir  (Etna)

Description: Spring blossom, red berry and botanical herb aromas mingle together on this fragrant rosato. On the savory palate, bright acidity accompanies juicy cherry, strawberry and white peach alongside the barest hint of baking spice.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2019 Le Rose Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This 100% Nerello Cappuccio, a grape usually used to blend with Nerello Mascalese, shows the juicy fruit allure of the variety. It opens with aromas of black skinned berries, dark spice, Mediterranean scrub and blue flowers while the soft, rounded palate doles out fleshy Morello cherry, white pepper and just a hint of tobacco. A salty note backs up the close, and lithe tannins provide seamless support. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Benanti 2018 Nerello Cappuccio (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This polished Negroamaro kicks off with aromas of crushed pepper, tobacco and violet. It's supple on the palate, yet properly fleshed out by cherry and plum flavors that are held in check by juicy acidity. Well-managed tannins lend just enough support, making this accessible in its youth.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tenute Rubino 2018 Virgilius Negroamaro (Brindisi)

Description: Aromas of brandy dipped cherries and blueberries meld with peppery spice and violet on the well-formed nose. It's medium in weight but lifted by zesty acidity and framed by crunchy tannins, with flavors of violet and crushed granite studding the tangy red-berry core. While delightful now, drink from mid-2021 for the tannins to mellow a bit further.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Botromagno 2017 Nero di Troia (Puglia)

Description: Pronounced aromas of violet and tilled earth meld with a cherry and plum core. It's light in frame, but not lacking intensity. Cherry and plum-skin tones are propped up by bright acidity and a firm webbing of tannins.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Trullo Flaminio 2018 Negroamaro (Brindisi)

Description: Inviting aromas of Mediterranean scrub, ripe black-skinned fruit and culinary spice lead the nose. Smooth and savory, the juicy, accessible palate offers ripe blackberry, prune and a hint of licorice accompanied by polished tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2017 Tenuta Regaleali Lamùri Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of cocoa, coffee and rich plum carry the nose. This red is medium bodied in weight, with rich fruit tones that are studded with plenty of warm spices. It ends with a bit of heat and spice.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Apollonio 2014 Terragnolo Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: Made with Nerello Mascalese, this has delicate scents evoking red berries, Mediterranean brush and wet stone. It's bright and juicy, offering tart sour cherry and white pepper alongside vibrant acidity before closing on a hint of rusty nail.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattorie Romeo del Castello 2018 Vigorosa Nerello Mascalese (Etna)

Description: Enticing aromas of blue flower, red-skinned berry and white pepper lead the way. The juicy palate offers raspberry and raw almond alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pertinace 2018  Dolcetto d'Alba

Description: Aromas of tobacco, slightly charred beef and pink peppercorn start off the savory nose. It's smooth and rounded on the medium-bodied palate, with flavors of dark cherry, anise and crushed pepper.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tagaro 2017 Passo del Sud Edizione Nero di Troia (Puglia)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of violet, crushed black pepper and raspy bramble berries frame the balanced, zesty nose. Tangy red berries arise on the medium-bodied palate, accented by plenty of floral and spice tones while fruit flavors, acidity and tannins mingle in equal measure.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Rivera 2017 Violante Nero di Troia (Castel del Monte)

Description: Rich tones of plum and blueberry are lifted by a pronounced floral tone on the nose. It's well balanced in tones of prune and plum on the palate, with a solid yet supple frame giving it an approachable feel.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: San Marzano 2019 Talò Malvasia Nera (Salento)

Description: Dense aromas of plum and cherry jam are met with hefty oak spices on the nose. It's broad and rich in feel on the palate, but well honed by lifted acidity and a firm framing of medium-grained tannins. The oak sticks out a bit on the midpalate, but the rich fruit resolves it well on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Vespa 2015 Helena Nero di Troia (Puglia)

Description: Appealing aromas of red-skinned berry and white pepper emerge from the glass. The savory palate offers crushed raspberry and raw almond alongside round tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Abrigo Fratelli 2018  Dolcetto d'Alba

Description: Dried thyme, blood orange and red-plum aromas carry to the fleshy palate. This is a well-mannered red that's propped up by bright acidity and a gentle grip of polished tannins.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: San Marzano 2019 Talò Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: This opens with aromas of oak-driven spice, Mediterranean scrub and black-skinned berries. The linear palate shows prune and star anise, while racy acidity keeps it light on its feet. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2017 Tenuta Regaleali Guarnaccio Perricone (Sicilia)

Description: This has aromas of red-skinned berry, baking spice and a whiff of leafy underbrush. The straightforward, easy-drinking palate offers red cherry, orange peel and clove alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: San Silvestro 2019  Dolcetto d'Alba

Description: Brandy soaked plum and plenty of sweet and savory spices grace the nose of this lush red. The palate is soft and supple, yet properly lifted by enough tangy red fruit to balance out the sweet spice flavors.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tagaro 2017 Seicaselle Negroamaro (Salice Salentino)

Description: Aromas of slightly charred plum and blackberry meld with dashes of crushed pepper and warm spice on the nose. It's rounded and supple on the palate, with tangy acidity coiled around plush flavors of dark cherry and plum.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Danti 2016 Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: Subdued aromas suggesting leather and menthol lead the nose. The brooding palate offers cherry marinated in spirits and clove alongside assertive, rather astringent tannins and the heat of evident alcohol.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Abrigo Fratelli 2018  Dolcetto d'Alba Superiore

Description: Cooking-spice, leafy underbrush and just-fermented wine aromas lead the nose. The simple palate offers red cherry and raw almond alongside rounded tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Abbazia 2018  Dolcetto d'Alba

Description: Ripe cherry and brambleberry aromas carry heady doses of anise, cinnamon and orange spice on the nose. It's soft and supple on the palate, with toasted berry flavors melding with pliant tannins and smooth acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Crifo 2019 Nero di Troia (Puglia)

Description: An earthy barnyard tone melds with crushed peppercorn and violet on the nose, as tense red berries ride underneath. It's tangy and delicate on the palate, driven by tart strawberry and raspberry flavors that are framed by sandy tannins. Slicks of green herbal spice and wet stone arise on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Valentina Passalacqua 2018 Nero di Troia (Puglia)

Description: Aromas of cherry, plum and latex carry the easygoing nose. The medium-bodied palate offers a load of sweet spice tones like vanilla, anise and cocoa that outshine the dark-plum core.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Vigneti del Salento 2018 I Muri Negroamaro (Puglia)

Description: Cedar, eucalyptus, Mediterranean scrub and wild berry are just some of the aromas you'll find on this gorgeous red. On the drop-dead delicious palate, smoky mineral and licorice accent a core of juicy Morello cherry and blood orange. Fresh acidity and lithe, polished tannins provide elegant support. Drink through 2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tascante 2017 Contrada Sciaranuova Vigna Vecchia  (Etna)

Description: Enticingly fragrant, this offers heady scents of violet, wild rose, Mediterranean scrub and woodland berry. Smooth and absolutely delicious, the round, enveloping palate has a weightless depth, delivering succulent crushed raspberry, ripe Morello cherry, licorice and tangy mineral notes suggesting wet stone. It's already accessible, with polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monterosso 2016 Sisma  (Etna)

Description: Fragrant and loaded with finesse, this opens with enticing aromas of Mediterranean brush, violet, crushed lemon thyme and star anise. On the savory, focused palate, notes of licorice, hazelnut and flinty mineral accent a juicy red berry core. Polished tannins and fresh acidity provide seamless support and balance. Drink 2021–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2018 San Lorenzo  (Etna)

Description: Graphite, thyme, brambly berry and violet aromas waft out of the glass along with Mediterranean scrub. Boasting youthful tension, the chiseled palate delivers succulent Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and coffee bean set against elegant, fine-grained tannins. Bright acidity keeps it balanced while a hint of saline lingers on the close. Drink through 2033.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2018 Feudo di Mezzo  (Etna)

Description: Enticingly fragrant, this delicious red opens with heady aromas of rose, violet, perfumed berry and Mediterranean scrub. The savory, rounded palate doles out juicy black cherry, spiced cranberry, blood orange and tobacco. Lithe tannins offer seamless support. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattorie Romeo del Castello 2017 Allegracore  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of wild herb, violet, red berry and a hint of hazelnut come to the forefront. Taut and focused, the ethereally elegant palate offers red cherry, blood orange, star anise and a hint of espresso before a saline close. Fine-grained tannins and bright acidity provide graceful support.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2018 Calderara Sottana  (Etna)

Description: Heady aromas of botanical herbs, fragrant purple flowers and eucalyptus are front and center. On the full-bodied palate, notes of licorice, blood orange and tangy mineral accent a core of dried cherry. Close-grained tannins offer taut support. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Girolamo Russo 2017 Feudo di Mezzo  (Etna)

Description: Fragrant purple flower, Mediterranean scrub, ripe dark-skinned berry and eucalyptus aromas are front and center on this sleek red, along with a whiff of graphite. Savory and concentrated, the succulent palate doles out mature Morello cherry, ripe raspberry, star anise and clove before a salty mineral close. Polished tannins keep it supple. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monterosso 2017 Volcano  (Etna)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the only example of this variety from the valley, but it shows the potential. The aromas are distinctive, with notes of earth, crushed granite, black cherry, raspberry and leather. Anise shows over time. Dense, focused fruit flavors follow, with firm, slightly rustic tannins backing them up. Lively acidity keeps it all in focus. Best after 2026.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2014 Aglianico (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of blackberry, truffle, purple flowers and Mediterranean scrub shape the enticing nose along with whiffs of dark spice. Polished and bright, the elegantly structured palate features ripe raspberry, black cherry and licorice alongside refined tannins. It closes on a hint of espresso. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2018 Santo Spirito  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of crushed Mediterranean herbs, olive tapenade and peppery spices meld with steeped prune and dark cherry tones in this delicious red that's sourced from the winery's Salento property. There's weight and power to the palate, echoing the savory and fruity tones of the nose. The structure is firm, yet polished, giving it an approachable feel for enjoyment in the near term.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tormaresca 2016 Masseria Maìme Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: Mediterranean scrub, plum and blue flower aromas mingle together in the glass along with whiffs of moist earth. Savory and refined, the elegant, accessible palate delivers juicy black cherry, wild raspberry, star anise and saline mineral notes framed in polished tannins. It's fresh and balanced, with bright acidity. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Benanti 2018 Contrada Dafara Galluzzo  (Etna)

Description: Camphor, Mediterranean scrub and cedar aromas mingle with a whiff of blue flowers. Smooth and full bodied, the palate doles out dried cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Girolamo Russo 2017 Caldera Sottana  (Etna)

Description: Fragrant blue flower, underbrush, wild berry and Mediterranean brush aromas form the nose on this vibrant red, grown on high altitude slopes. The tense, racy palate offers sour cherry, orange zest and star anise alongside taut, fine-grained tannins and an acidic backbone. Drink 2022–2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2018 Guardiola  (Etna)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied, bold wine is rich in color, flavor and texture, showing a black hue with deep ruby rim, aromas of cooked blueberries and dark chocolate, and generous black-fruit flavors wrapped in dense fine-grained tannins. Best through 2026.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terra d'Oro 2018 Teroldego (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied muscular wine is bold in flavor and moderately tannic in texture, offering mineral, pepper and smoke nuances along with rich blackberry and black cherry. It nicely balances elements of strength and complexity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terra d'Oro 2018 Aglianico (Amador County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Made from a little-seen grape, at least in the New World, this is always a fascinating wine to try, and it begins with aromas of darkly roasted berry, black-plum skins and dried rose petals. Even at this age, there is a strong tannic edge to the palate, where blueberry and blackberry are spiced by mace, clove and cola into the firm finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Matela 2013 Le Bon Climat Vineyard Teroldego (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This has a rather shy nose that eventually reveals whiffs of botanical herb, cedar and underbrush. Racy and rather lean, the focused palate shows dried cherry, coffee bean and clove alongside bright acidity. Close-grained tannins leave a drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2018 Moganazzi  (Etna)

Description: Meaty, gamy aromas and rich plummy flavors make this full-bodied wine likeable and different. It feels extra smooth in texture, low in tannins but high in fruit and subtle peppery spices.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Prima Materia 2018 Vinum in Agris Negroamaro

Description: Zesty aromas of crushed thyme, bay leaf and eucalyptus ride over a spiced cranberry and plum core. This is light and easy on the palate, giving juicy red fruit and soft, polished tannins. Integrated acidity is the main driver here, but it plays well with the fruit and spice elements, never seeming out of place.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Coppi 2018 Pellirosso Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: Mediterranean brush, cedar and rose scents mingle with a whiff of toasted nut. On the chiseled, rather lean palate, a smoky mineral note accents sour cherry, fennel and blood orange alongside taut, dusty tannins that leave a lean, drying close. Drink 2021–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Benanti 2018 Contrada Cavaliere  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of thyme, crushed pepper and mixed crushed berries take a bit to show on the nose but carry good concentration as it opens up. Juicy red plum and wild bramble berries unite alongside fistfuls of crushed herbs and peppery spice on the palate. This is pleasantly fruity, but reined in well by a solid frame of gripping tannins and persistent acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Masseria Li Veli 2018 Primonero Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: This wine is deep in color, bold in flavors and firm in texture, offering focused blackberry and black pepper and moderate tannins. It needs rich proteins to pair with and should be best after 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Prima Materia 2016 Refosco

Description: Aromas of French oak, coconut and camphor lead the nose. Reflecting the nose, the taut palate offers dried cherry, prune and oak-driven spice set against grainy tannins that leave an astringent finish. It doesn't have the fruit richness to stand up to the oak.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattorie Romeo del Castello 2016 Vigo  (Etna)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Not a common or easy variety to ripen in the Willamette valley, this is a tart, dry, austere wine that is a bit hard to love. The fruit is subsumed by the tannins, with notes of smoke, black olive and graphite rather than any sweet ripe berry flavors. That said, the right match (steak) would work with it.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2018 Dolcetto (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: Aromas of bright cherry, anise and cinnamon start off this straightforward red. This is light in feel and fruity on the palate in bouncy cherry and berry flavors. It shows a nice balance but is ultimately quite simple. It's a great buy as a weekday red.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Rivera 2018 Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: This offers aromas of spring blossoms and red berry. It's bright and simple, offering sour cherry and strawberry alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monte Zovo 2019 Phasianus Corvina (Veronese)

Description: Aromas of graphite, hazelnut and scorched earth form the subtle nose. The lean palate is already evolved, showing mere suggestions of unripe berry, citrus, saline and roasted coffee bean. Astringent tannins give it an abrupt, mouthdrying close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Valenti 2015 Norma  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of wild red berry, rose petal, wet stone, Mediterranean brush and star anise shape the nose on this compelling, vibrant wine. Made with Nerello Mascalese planted in 1961, the wine has a linear, racy palate that's almost ethereal and loaded with finesse and energy, delivering sour cherry, pomegranate, licorice and orange zest before a flinty mineral close. Taut, refined tannins and vibrant acidity lend lithe support. Drink 2024–2036.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tascante 2016 Contrada Sciaranuova VV Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Here's another stunning wine from this fantastic estate, opening with aromas of underbrush, wild berry, tobacco, rose and dried mint. The structured, elegant palate delivers crushed raspberry, strawberry compote, star anise and flinty mineral, while taut, refined tannins provide finesse and support. Drink 2021–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2017 Contrada G Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Violet, Mediterranean herb and red berry are just some of the aromas you'll find on this compelling wine. Silky and full bodied, the palate delivers raspberry compote, crushed Marasca cherry, star anise and flinty mineral alongside taut, refined tannins. Fresh acidity and a mineral vein add tension. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2017 Contrada C Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Enticing aromas of graphite, Mediterranean scrub and wild berry shape the nose of this compelling wine. The vibrant, structured palate is loaded with finesse and tension, delivering crushed strawberry, red cherry, star anise and orange zest, while notes of botanical herbs and a vein of flinty mineral lend depth. Racy acidity and lithe tannins provide energy and support. Drink through 2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Frank Cornelissen 2016 Munjebel VA Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Mixing power and finesse, this full-bodied red opens with intriguing aromas suggesting smoke, graphite, truffle, molten chocolate and wild black-skinned berry. On the structured, enveloping palate, velvety tannins wrap around blackberry jam, crushed black raspberry, licorice and grilled herbs, while a mineral note lingers on the finish. Tangy acidity lifts the finish. Drink now–2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Frank Cornelissen 2017 Munjebel Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Wild cherry, crushed mint, forest floor and graphite aromas shape the nose on this gorgeous wine along with an earthy whiff of new leather. It's full bodied and elegantly structured, doling out Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and flinty mineral alongside enveloping, velvety tannins. Drink 2021–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2017 Contrada P Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Intense and linear, this vibrant red has intriguing aromas of wild red berry, violet, dark spice, crushed stone and eucalyptus. On the lithe, racy palate, polished tannins and lively acidity frame crunchy red cherry, strawberry compote, orange zest and licorice before a saline finish. Drink 2021–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tascante 2016 Contrada Rampante Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Underbrush, wet stone and camphor aromas meld with whiffs of scorched earth and Mediterranean scrub. The full-bodied, enveloping palate delivers dried Marasca cherry, orange zest, raspberry compote, fennel and flint alongside velvety tannins and lively acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2017 Contrada R Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Delicious and loaded with finesse, this Nerello Mascalese delivers aromas and flavors of ripe black cherry, blackberry and star anise, while smoky flint adds depth. Lithe, elegant tannins provide the polished framework.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2017 Eruzione 1614 Nerello Mascalese (Sicilia)

Description: Eucalyptus, Mediterranean herb and wild berry aromas mingle with a whiff of wet stone. It's full bodied and youthfully austere but also boasts a weightless elegance, doling out black cherry, flinty mineral and bitter almond sensations before a licorice close. Thanks to the ripe fruit flavors, you'd never guess this had a hefty abv of 15%.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2017 Contrada S Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, Mediterranean scrub, new leather and crushed mint are front and center in this elegant, full-bodied red. It's smooth and delicious, doling out blackberry jam, carob and rosemary alongside lithe, polished tannins, while a citrus zest note picks up on the finish. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tornatore 2017 Pietrarizzo Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of smoke and strawberry mingle with whiffs of Mediterranean scrub on this compelling red. The aromas carry on to the savory, elegant palate along with red cherry, exotic spice and flinty mineral. It's balanced and loaded with finesse, with lithe tannins and bright acidity. Drink through 2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Frank Cornelissen 2017 Susucaru Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Aromas of coconut, Mediterranean scrub and black-skinned berry mingle with French oak and spice. The elegantly structured palate doles out ripe Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice, espresso and exotic spice set against fine-grained tannins. Bright acidity keeps it fresh and balanced. Drink 2021–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Donnafugata 2016 Fragore Contrada Montelaguarda  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of strawberry, red cherry and white pepper follow over to the polished, savory palate, along with hints of smoke and pomegranate. It's silky and bright, with fresh acidity, making it incredibly delicious to enjoy now.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2018 Frappato (Vittoria)

Description: Aromas of ripe wild berry and Mediterranean scrub alongside a whiff of eucalyptus take shape in the glass. Juicy and smooth, the palate offers crushed raspberry, strawberry compote, licorice and notes of exotic incense framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. A tangy mineral note gives the finish tension. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2017 Passorosso  (Etna)

Description: Mediterranean scrub, rose and wild berry aromas shape the fragrant nose. Smooth and savory, the linear palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, pomegranate, clove and mineral notes suggesting saline. Polished tannins and fresh acidity lend lithe support. Drink 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2018 Rosso Nerello Mascalese (Sicilia)

Description: Glossy and bright, this opens with alluring aromas of camphor, wild red berry, violet and wet stone. The elegant palate delivers juicy red cherry, orange slice, star anise and crushed mint alongside flexible tannins and racy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tascante 2017 Ghiaia Nera Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Mediterranean brush and exotic spice aromas combine with whiffs of wet stone and wild herbs on this 100% Nerello Mascalese. The aromas march on to the palate together with ripe Marasca cherry, licorice and dried mint. Taut but lithe tannins and bright acidity provide support. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Fessina 2014 Il Musmeci Riserva Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Violet, wild red berry and Mediterranean brush aromas mingle with a whiff of wet stone. It's polished, delicious and easygoing, delivering black berry, crushed raspberry and star anise alongside bright acidity and lithe, elegant tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Torre Mora 2018 Cauru Rosso  (Etna)

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting scorched earth, carob, Mediterranean scrub and prune. Reflecting the nose, the brawny palate offers hazelnut, raisin, orange zest and dried mint alongside smooth, enveloping tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Frank Cornelissen 2016 Magma Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Rose, red berry and Asian incense aromas lift out of the glass on this fragrant red. Made entirely with Nerello Mascalese, the elegant palate delivers sour cherry, pomegranate, exotic spice and saline mineral notes alongside pliant tannins and bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Donnafugata 2016 Sul Vulcano Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of smoky flint, leather, red berry and brown spice mingle with whiffs of game and rusty iron. The aromas follow over to the firmly structured but linear palate along with ripe Marasca cherry, orange zest and carob. Tight, dusty tannins and mineral tension provide the framework.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Fessina 2017 Laeneo Nerello Cappuccio (Sicilia)

Description: Wild berry, geranium, Mediterranean scrub and eucalyptus aromas lift out of the glass. This is made entirely from the native grape Nocera, and its smooth palate boasts dense fruit, including ripe raspberry, black cherry and plum, while white pepper adds depth. Soft and enveloping, it's made to be enjoyed young, so drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2017 Nocera (Sicilia)

Description: Scorched earth, blue flower and plum mix with balsamic aromas of camphor on this brawny red. Full-bodied and concentrated, the dense—almost syrupy—palate offers dried cherry, prune, mint and star anise alongside tight, close-grained tannins that leave a rather astringent, drying finish. You'll also detect the heat of evident alcohol.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pietradolce 2016 Barbagalli Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Fresh and savory, this elegant, crowd-pleasing red has aromas of red and black-skinned berry and culinary spice. Juicy and delicious, the lithe palate doles out succulent Morello cherry, crushed raspberry and star anise while polished tannins offer smooth support. It's made to be drunk young, so enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2017 Tenuta Regaleali Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Juicy and savory, this has aromas evoking black-skinned berry, crushed mint, carob and a hint of Mediterranean brush. On the linear, taut palate, dusty tannins accompany juicy blackberry, blueberry and almond. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Montoni 2018 Core Perricone (Sicilia)

Description: Scorched earth, ripe black-skinned fruit and a whiff of game lead the nose. The aromas follow over to the vigorous palate along with dusty tannins. It's a bit rustic but also full of personality. Give it a few more years to fully integrate, then drink. Best 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Benanti 2017 Nerello Cappuccio (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Aromas evoking underbrush, scorched soil, dark spice and Mediterranean scrub slowly appear in the glass. On the linear, firmly structured palate, close-grained tannins accompany dried cherry, star anise and an earthy hint of game. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Terrazze dell'Etna 2012 Cimeco  (Etna)

Description: Made with Nero d'Avola, this opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, Mediterranean brush and cooking spice. The juicy palate offers blackberry jam, star anise and vanilla alongside velvety tannins and bright acidity. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2015 Il Moro Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, carob and leather emerge from the glass of this 100% Nero d'Avola. The savory, elegant palate delivers ripe blackberry, licorice and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Enjoy through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: MandraRossa 2016 Cartagho Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, espresso and cedar emerge from the glass. The chewy palate offers blackberry jam, clove and cocoa alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Morgante 2016 Don Antonio Riserva Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned berry mingle with Mediterranean brush and dark spice. On the smooth, juicy palate, hints of tobacco and vanilla accent a fruity core of mature Marasca cherry and crushed blackberry. Polished tannins provide elegant support. Enjoy through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2017 Tenuta Regaleali Lamùri Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of blackberry and violet mingle with an earthy note of humid soil. Reflecting the nose, the juicy, straightforward palate offers blueberry jam, crushed raspberry and light note of salted game alongside lithe tannins. Enjoy through 2021.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Montoni 2018 Lagnusa Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made partly in steel and partly in wood, this has subtle aromas of black-skinned berry and spice with a whiff of French oak. The tight palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and roasted coffee bean alongside close-grained tannins that leave a firm finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sallier de la Tour 2017 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This opens with fruity aromas of red berry, star anise and violet. The aromas carry through to the juicy palate alongside notes of black cherry and white pepper. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2018 Bellifolli Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Ripe black-skinned berry, wild mint and carob aromas take center stage in this round red. The aromas carry over to the juicy, smooth palate along with blackberry jam and a hint of baking spice. Soft tannins offer light support. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Caruso & Minini 2018 Terre di Giumara Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made with organically grown Nero d'Avola, this has aromas of dark berry, Mediterranean scrub and cedar. The savory palate offers black cherry jam, tobacco and raw almond alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Caruso & Minini 2018 Naturalmente Bio Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of blue flower, mature berry and wild herbs lead the way. On the straightforward palate, polished tannins accompany dried black cherry and baking spice.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Patria 2017 Femina  (Etna)

Description: Made entirely from Nero d'Avola, this opens with dark berry, carob and Mediterranean brush aromas. The linear, savory palate offers blackberry, raspberry jam and black pepper alongside velvety tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Arancio 2017 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This opens with aromas of black-skinned berry and mocha with a whiff of coconut. The lively palate offers blackberry jam, tobacco and licorice alongside polished tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Solaria 2016 Foglio Cinquanta Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made entirely from Nero d'Avola, this has aromas of black-skinned berry, Mediterranean herb and carob. The straightforward, juicy palate offers black cherry, raspberry jam and white pepper alongside polished tannins. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Stemmari 2017 Estate Grown Sustainably Farmed Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This Nero d'Avola opens with aromas suggesting dark berry and cooking spice. The straightforward palate offers raspberry jam and carob alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fondo Antico 2017 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This easygoing red opens with dark berry and Mediterranean brush aromas. The soft, savory palate offers black cherry, star anise and a hint of white pepper alongside velvety tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Colosi 2018 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of French oak, coconut and blue flower lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the palate along with espresso, licorice and a green note of thyme, while grainy tannins leave an astringent close. It doesn't have the fruit richness to stand up to the dominant oak.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Rapitalà 2016  Etna

Description: Dark berry and black cooking spice aromas lead the nose. The simple palate offers blackberry jam and a hint of star anise alongside dusty tannins that dry out the finish. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Solaria 2017 Moro Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made with 100% native grape Pignola, this charming sparkler has delicate aromas of white stone fruit, alpine herb, red berry and a whiff of bread crust. The dry, chiseled palate offers white peach, citrus zest and pomegranate before a hazelnut finish. Bright acidity and an elegant perlage provide the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Perla Marco Triacca 2017 Metodo Classico Extra Brut Pignola (Alpi Retiche)

Description: The strongest offering of this producer's “alternative” red varieties, this northern Italian variety—not often seen Down Under—has some bottle age but still feels fresh as a daisy. The color of a black cherry and rose petal infusion, it's very fruity and perfumed, like strawberry, cherry and blueberry juice speckled with flower petals and wood spice. The palate is medium bodied and silky with a lovely grip of sappy tannins to balance the plump fruit. A pleasure-inducing drop to drink now slightly chilled.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Alpha Box & Dice 2016 Dead Winemakers Society Dolcetto (Adelaide Hills)

Description: This is a strong offering from young, cross-cultural couple Colleen and Sebastian Hardy (the latter of the Hardy family winemaking dynasty). Unoaked, this rarely seen Down Under Italian variety is allowed to shine. It's brambly, spicy and chocolaty. Think Morello cherries, ground pepper, bay leaf, dried mint and cocoa bean. It's medium to full bodied with soaring acidity and wonderfully raspy tannins. There's a rustic Italian vino di tavola vibe going on here that cries out for a pizza pie or a heaping bowl of Bolognese.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Living Roots 2018 Native Mulberry Teroldego (Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: It's always encouraging to see wineries explore uncommon grapes, and this spin on the dark Italian grape Aglianico succeeds. Aromas of black cherry and mushroom lead into a woody palate of sandalwood and boysenberry, all framed by buoyant acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Pear Valley 2017 Pear Valley Vineyard Aglianico (Paso Robles)

Description: Sourced from the warm climes of Langhorne Creek, this Italian varietal is radiant purple in color. Its 100% whole bunch fermentation has resulted in an intensely spicy, medicinal nose that bursts with licorice root, cherry cordial, violets and cocktail bitters. Medium in body, the mouthfeel is juicy and silky—and less overtly medicinal than the nose—wound by fine, chalky tannins. There's no oak here, so fruit purity is retained. This is a style that will be divisive. For this reviewer, it's a joyful, quirky drop.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Alpha Box & Dice 2019 Rebel Rebel Montepulciano (Langhorne Creek)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine packs in an abundance of black-fruit flavors without being heavy, overly tannic or especially oaky. Blackberry and cranberry flavors are carried by good acidity and moderate tannins that give it an appetizing grip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Amador Cellars 2016 Aglianico (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Rather tight and austere in mouthfeel, this wine should keep coming on with a few years in the cellar. It offers good tart cherry and black-plum flavors, lots of fine-grained tannins and yet feels polished on the finish. Best through 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sottomarino 2015 Aglianico (Lake County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very smooth and polished, this full-bodied wine boasts blackberry and roasted plum flavors and is generously accented by baking spices from new oak. It has considerable velvety tannins that make it mouthcoating.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Noceto 2016 Fumo E Terra Aglianico (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Heady tones of violet and rose ride over a dense wild-berry core in this wine sourced from the contrada Rotondo near the town of Barile. The medium-bodied palate is driven by lots of tangy crushed stone energy, with tightly coiled red fruit hiding behind it all. There's a real sense of hidden power to this wine, which needs time to unwind. Drink 2022–2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Paternoster 2015 Rotondo  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Named after the founder of the winery, this is an effusive, rich and structured wine. An enveloping nose of blueberry tart, sour cream, iodine and crushed rock carries to the broad palate, with roasted hazelnut chiming in. The fruit feels rounded and lush but held in check by pulsing acidity and fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Paternoster 2015 Don Anselmo  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane, Central Italy, Italy
Description: An intense aroma of brandied cherries melds with wood spice, mushroom and incense on the nose. The full-bodied palate is all about power, showing ample grip to the flavors of thick-skinned dark cherry and black plum, with tobacco and spice lingering on the sides. Despite all that intensity, there's still lots of bright, vibrant acidity and structured yet fine-grained tannins to balance it all. Drink though 2025.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Illuminati 2013 Pieluni Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A dark, dense nose of forest berries melds with tones of violet and delicate warm spices on the nose of this enveloping red. It is plush at first on the palate, but then the structured tannins take over. All the while, tart berry flavors fill it out, with a tangy mineral tone and bright acidity pushing it along. It has the structure and intensity to hold well in the cellar, but is still quite enjoyable now. Drink now through 2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: San Martino 2017 Siir  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Description: A dense core of red-cherry coulis is lifted up by bright mentholated herbs and tobacco on the nose of this riserva. Medium in weight, there's a tangy cherry tone to the palate, with firm, finely knit tannins and pulsing acidity providing the frame. More herbs and a slight granite twang linger on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Illuminati 2017 Ilico Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: This joint venture between Fattoria La Valentina in Abruzzo and Inama Azienda Agricola in Veneto offers aromas of baked cherry, mentholated herbs and a hint of soy on the nose. Rounded and silken in feel, the rich red fruit on the palate is bolstered by lifted acidity and fine, integrated tannins. These flavors are propelled along a pulsing river of acidity, with hints of herbs and earth chiming in. It's approachable now, but should hold well through 2025.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Binomio 2015 Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: This single-vineyard wine is sourced from a site that sits around 1,100 feet in elevation. A bright intensity of wild-cherry and red-plum aromas melds with hints of farmyard, Alpine herb and crushed stone on the nose. Firm tannins create a structured frame for tangy red fruit to hang on the palate, lifted by a savory mineral tone and bright acidity. It's a beautiful expression of Montepulciano from a mountain site.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Valle Reale 2011 Vigneto di Popoli  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of wild red berry, violet and rose waft out of the glass on this fragrant, fantastic sparkler. The vibrant, elegant palate doles out juicy strawberry, red cherry, orange zest and star anise before a dry finish. A lightly foaming mousse and bright acidity provide the food friendly structure. One bottle won't be enough.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paltrinieri 2018 Sant'Agata  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture Superiore, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: There's a bright intensity of pink peppercorn, violet, rosemary and spicy bramble on the nose of this riserva. The palate is linear and focused, showing a strong current of tart red fruit speckled with pepper and florals, while tangy minerality powers throughout. Firm tannins give a nice framing to it all—it's well structured yet elegant in feel.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Regio Cantina 2014 Campo Melograno Riserva  (Aglianico del Vulture Superiore)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A dense nose of ripe forest berries, iodine and anise and peppery spice kick off this well-balanced Aglianico. It is polished yet firm on the palate, dominated by thick-skinned dark-berry notes and pushed along by a powerful line of acidity. The tannins are up front at the moment, but fruit is riding not too far behind. Drink from 2022–2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: San Martino 2017 Arberesko  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Description: Made entirely from Montepulciano, this red starts off with a bright nose of tobacco, crushed herbs and black pepper. The palate is silky smooth and succulent in a firm red-cherry flavor, with plenty of acidity and gripping tannins holding it all in check. Crushed stone and more herbs add interest to the lingering finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Torre Zambra 2016  Villamagna

Description: A warm, generous nose of wild cherry, baking spices and violet carry to the plump palate. A firm frame of tannins provides ample grip to the ripe berry flavors, with a tangy crushed stone note reverberating underneath. There's great balance here between plushness and restraint.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: D'Angelo 2016 Canneto Aglianico (Basilicata)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: There's richness on the nose in tones of liquor-soaked dark cherries and wild berries that are covered in a sheen of sandalwood, coconut and singed rosemary. Thick-skinned dark-berry flavors are propped up by pulsing acidity on the medium-bodied palate, with a firm grip of tannins lending support. It's flashy and forward but with a likeable personality.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: San Martino 2013 Kamai  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Description: Savory tones of dried tobacco and mentholated herbs ride over a ripe bramble-berry core on the nose. The light-bodied palate follows suit, adding in a tangy crushed stone. There's real grip to the tannins but the succulent, crunchy fruit offers a fine counterbalance.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Illuminati 2018 Riparosso  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A coiled intensity of rose petal, pink peppercorn and rosemary carry the nose and echo on the medium-bodied palate, with a properly deep core of ripe forest berries giving way. Firm yet polished tannins and bright acidity create a solid structure for the whole, making this entirely enjoyable in the near term but able to linger in the cellar. Drink now–2025.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: D'Angelo 2016  Aglianico del Vulture

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A perfumed nose of crushed violets, pink peppercorn and red berries carries to the linear, medium-bodied palate.
