Electric minerality races along as tart red fruit seamlessly melds with savory, peppery spices. This shows a sturdy frame of tannins for support, but is still enjoyable in the near term. Drink now–2025.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Regio Cantina 2016 Donpà  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Description: Sourced from the winery's highest vineyard, which sits at 1,600 feet above sea level, this red offers a seductive nose of wild strawberry, dark cherry, crushed Alpine herbs and green tobacco on the nose. It's smooth and seamless on the palate, lifted by a bright vein of acidity and a clean line of crushed stone. There's crunchy red fruit at the core, with a savory mineral note extending from start to finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Valle Reale 2017 Vigneto Sant'Eusanio  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Bright aromas of pink peppercorn, violet, rose and red currant show pleasing depth and integration on the nose. The palate is light in feel but well structured by pulsing acidity and a firm frame of tannins. Tart red fruit remains dominant, with light pepper and game notes chiming in on the midpalate, and rose and violet lingering on the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Rivera 2014 Cappellaccio Riserva Aglianico (Castel del Monte)

Appellation: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane, Central Italy, Italy
Description: There's enviable concentration on the nose of this wine, delivering plumes of dark cherry, plum, salt and tobacco. There's power and verve to the thick-skinned berry fruit on the medium-bodied palate, built up by a sturdy frame of tannins and pushed along by a refreshing vein of acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Nicodemi 2017 Notàri  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)

Appellation: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of crushed herbs and spiced cherry show a pleasing depth on the nose. Medium in weight, the palate brings juicy red cherry, tobacco and earth, with slightly sandy tannins rising up on the finish. Sourced from a single vineyard in the Colline Teramane DOCG, it shows very good vibrancy and concentration.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Illuminati 2015 Zanna Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)

Description: Bright red cherry melds with crushed granite and herbs on the nose of this red. The medium-bodied palate is juicy in a vibrant red-cherry flavor, with a line of crunchy tannins and vibrant acidity propping it up.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: La Valentina 2016 Spelt Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of French oak, underbrush and prune carry over to the chewy, medium-bodied palate along with vanilla and carob. Solid tannins provide support. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fonzone 2012  Taurasi

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This is a light, zippy Aglianico that shows an amazing sense of drive. Crushed pink peppercorn, rose and tart berries are framed by tangy acidity and a vibrant mineral undercurrent. The tannins are mellowed and smooth, lingering in the background but still lending enough support.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: D'Angelo 2013 Caselle  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Description: Opaque ruby in color, with dense purple highlights, this red is rich in dark cherry and plum, mixed with tobacco and a hint of rubber. Time in stainless steel and concrete has left the fruit pure and clean, yielding a dark-fruit-coulis flavor on the palate that's brightened up by a brisk line of crushed stone. Well-mannered tannins and integrated acidity lend just enough support.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cataldi Madonna 2017 Malandrino  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of hot gravel, iron and tangy red berries show on the energetic, savory nose. There's power to the palate in a bright red-berry flavor that's lifted by juicy acidity. Firm tannins lend support but don't detract from the forward, fruity palate.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Novaripa 2016 Monatic Dark  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of hazelnut and campfire ride over a wild-berry core in this wine. There's a pleasant plumpness to the palate, hemmed by a line of tart acidity and crunchy mineral tones. A structured frame of firm medium-grained tannins lends support to this otherwise accessible Aglianico.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Paternoster 2016 Synthesi  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Description: This full-bodied wine offers friendly, jammy aromas and good, grapey flavors supported by firm tannins. It's quaffable and fun, a bit unusual for this varietal.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Paskett 2017 Estate Charbono (Lodi)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture Superiore, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Dense aromas of tobacco leaf, goji berries, dried cranberry, pressed rose and pink peppercorn start this off. It is rounded and plush in feel on entry, but broadened out by baked red-fruit flavors that are lifted by tangy acidity. Earthy floral tones rise up on the midpalate, with a hint of tomato chiming in. The copious tannins build a tightly knit frame, but the fruit and acidity do well to push through.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bisceglia 2014 Gudarrà  (Aglianico del Vulture Superiore)

Description: Subdued aromas of dill and incense waft out of the glass. The palate is full in feel, with oak tones at the fore and juicy brandied cherry at the core. The tannins show some grit and grip, yet there's plenty of vibrant acidity to balance it out.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Torre Zambra 2015 Colle Maggio Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Lifted tones of violet and pink peppercorn meld with a dried goji berry core on the nose. The palate is tense in feel, driven by a rush of acidity but properly restrained by a framing of well-mannered tannins. Juicy, tart red fruit dominates, with lingering peppery spice and mineral notes on the finish. Drink now.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: D'Angelo 2017 Sacravite Aglianico (Basilicata)

Description: Lifted aromas of cranberry, hibiscus and orange rind are front and center, with a hint of banana in the background. Medium in weight, the palate is driven by cherry and lemon tones, with a gentle grip of tannins on the finish. It's a fruit forward yet well balanced rosato.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Torre Zambra 2019 Colle Zambra  (Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo)

Description: Lifted notes of mentholated herbs and small red berries carry the bright, crisp nose. It's silken in feel on entry, lifted by juicy acidity and polished tannins. A core of tart red berries abounds on the palate, with a dusting of crushed minerals and a slight grip of tannins on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina Valle Tritana 2016  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: A cherry-coulis tone melds with tobacco and earth on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is bright in acidity, with loads of tangy red-berry flavors alongside tar and iodine. It ends rich in feel, with just enough lift for balance.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cataldi Madonna 2015 Tonì  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of earth, red flowers and warm baking spice cover the red-cherry fruit on the nose. The palate is full in feel, with a blanket of anise and allspice surrounding the rich red-fruit core.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Torre Zambra 2016 Colle Maggio  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of crushed, mentholated herbs, blackberry and black pepper are lifted and pure on the nose. This light-bodied Montepulciano offers a succulent core of cherry and blackberry flavors on the palate, all framed by fine yet supportive tannins. It's a great everyday red that would be a welcome addition to the dinner table.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Umani Ronchi 2018 Podere  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of crushed gravel, red cherry, currant and Alpine herbs yield a fresh, zesty start to this red. It's silky smooth on the palate, built up by plenty of crunchy berry flavors and polished tannins. A resounding tart cherry note lingers on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Novaripa 2017 Agronika  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: This entry-level wine from Valle Reale is produced from organic grapes and sees no time in oak. The result is a pure, fresh wine that dazzles in flavors of tangy red plum and succulent red cherry. Lifted acidity and delicate, sandy tannins frame it all, giving it enough structure and verve to be enjoyed at the dinner table.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Valle Reale 2018  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: Intense cherry-red in color, this traditional Cerasuolo offers a rich dark-red-berry flavor on the palate, lifted by bright acidity and a gentle framing of tannins. Medium in weight, it shows plenty of heft to stand up to enjoyment in the cooler months of the year.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Novaripa 2018 Agronika  (Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This red is showing a rather developed nose of hoisin, dried cherries, goji berries and dried violet. It is soft and supple in feel, yet lifted by a proper vein of acidity. The tannins are fine but provide a firm grip on the midpalate and ultimately clench up the finish. Tangy mineral tones ride underneath, with more floral tones chiming in.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bisceglia 2015 Gudarrà  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Description: Mild aromas of red berries and grilled herbs carries the nose. This light-bodied red offers a straightforward fresh red-cherry flavor, lifted up by juicy acidity. The tannins provide just enough framing and grip.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Citra 2018 Estate Grown  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: Generous black-fruit aromas and flavors give this full-bodied and tightly wrapped wine a good center, while firm tannins make it appetizing to sip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Eclectic 2015 Charbono (Suisun Valley)

Description: This light- to medium-bodied Montepulciano boasts a cohesive nose of ripe dark cherry, plum juice, anise and tobacco leaf on the nose and palate. It's bright and tangy in feel, honed in by a gentle hug of raspy tannins. This is a great weekday red to be enjoyed alongside pasta marinara.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina Valle Tritana 2017 Tritàno  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: High-toned aromas of cherry and plum meld with a sweet tone of cigar box on the nose. The palate is smooth and sultry, with juicy shots of acidity brightening it up, but all the while there's a lingering sheen of sweet oak. The tannins are rather in charge on the end, giving it a bold and brash feel.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Umani Ronchi 2015 Centovie  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This approachable Aglianico is rounded in dark cherry and blackberry tones, with warm, sweet spices filling it out. There's good lift and vitality to the palate, with tangy acidity propelling it along while soft tannins offer a gentle frame. White pepper and violet linger on the close. Drink now.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bisceglia 2017 Terra di Vulcano  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Appellation: Terre del Volturno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals aromas of black-skinned fruit, moist forest floor, dark spice and a whiff of game. Reflecting the nose, the earthy palate offers dried black cherry, blackberry and clove alongside grainy almost gritty tannins that leave a firm, drying finish. It's not for everyone but it has a rustic charm.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vigne Chigi 2018 Pallagrello Nero (Terre del Volturno)

Description: This wine is closed on the nose, offering a quiet tin-can tone. Light in feel, the fruit is not very intense on the palate, showing a straightforward juicy red-cherry note. Gentle tannins ride alongside bright acidity to lend support.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: La Valentina 2017  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: Inky ruby in color, with purple highlights, this wine smells rich on the nose in tones of toasted vanilla, tobacco and brandy-soaked cherries. The palate follows suit, bolstered by a ripping line of acidity. Oaky tones of dill and vanilla linger on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Moro Wines 2013 Morus  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of prunes and dried herbs lead to peppery, pruney flavors that are decently rich and tasty. With no added sulfites, the wine doesn't have the usual commercial style, but can be enjoyable.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Frey 2018 Organic Wine Charbono (Mendocino)

Appellation: Aglianico del Vulture, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of autumn leaves, small red berries and savory spice carry the nose. The medium-bodied palate is smooth and supple, with a dried currant and cherry core that's bolstered by mildly bitter tannins.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Regio Cantina 2017 Genesi  (Aglianico del Vulture)

Description: A cherry-jelly aroma melds with geranium on the nose. Light in feel, the palate is straightforward and driven by lots of tart red cherry. The tannins are soft and supple, with the structure mostly coming from the driving acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Torre Zambra 2017 Madia  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of sawdust and anise carry the nose, not giving away much fruit. The palate is more boisterous in cherry and plum tones, with a sheen of warm spice and wood notes on top. Soft tannins and bright acidity lend support to the whole.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Nevio 2016  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Description: Bright red cherry and toasted vanilla carry the nose. The palate shows sweet red fruit, with a sheen of more vanilla and sweet baking spices. It displays a fine structure, but the oak comes off too forward.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Umani Ronchi 2018 Montipagano  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: A dense nose of iodine, plum and warm spices carries to the rich, thick palate. The dark-fruit flavors are ensconced in big tannins and plenty of warm spice tones. Toasted vanilla reverberates on the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina Ripa Teatina 2014 Rocky Marciano  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of red fruit, flower and overripe apple lead to lighter styled flavors. It doesn't all work in harmony, with the volatiles amped up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Waterbrook 2017 Icon Estate Dolcetto (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of brandy-soaked plums and cherries meld with a heavy dose of vanilla, dill and sandalwood on the nose. The palate is thick in feel, built up by a host of oaky flavors. There is freshness from tangy acidity behind all that density, but ultimately the oak wins out on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina Zaccagnini 2017 Dal Tralcetto  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Candied aromas of cherry and strawberry mix with mentholated herbs, giving the nose a cough drop-like sensibility. The palate is rich and full in feel but shot through with rapier-like acidity that seems rather sharp, while grating tannins add to the disjointed nature of the wine.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Novaripa 2014 Spyro Riserva Limited Edition  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

Description: This breezy red offers a simplistic palate of geranium, tilled earth and cranberry. Built more by tangy acidity, the tannins are gossamer thin, making this light and easy.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Stella 2017  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Leathery, elegant aromas of dried berries, cherry compote and aged charcuterie show on the nose of this bottling. The palate weaves earthy tones of leather and dried rose petals with richer Luxardo cherry flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Palmina 2016 Walker Vineyard Dolcetto (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black-currant, forest-floor, cocoa and turned earth aromas make for a very dense and layered nose on this bottling of the grape originally from Northern Italy. It snaps and grips on the sip, with tangy fruit and purple-flower flavors ranging from grape soda to mocha and dust.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Santa Barbara Winery 2016 Joughin Vineyard Lagrein (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep aromas of cola, mint, gooey chocolate and rust show on the nose of this bottling. Firm tannins frame the blackberry jam, mint and cocoa flavors, and then strong barrel influence arises in clove and cardamom accents.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Alara 2017 Montepulciano (San Benito County)

Description: Made from 100% Corvina, this structured, velvety red opens with enticing aromas of black-skinned berry, cedar and tobacco. The full-bodied, balanced palate offers blackberry jam, Morello cherry, licorice and black pepper alongside fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink through 2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Allegrini 2013 La Poja Corvina (Veronese)

Description: This vintage of ex-pat American grower-winemaker Brad Hickey's Nero is on fire. Open and expressive, a heady concoction of cinnamon, flower stalk, potpourri, cocktail bitters, red licorice and stony minerals come wafting out of the glass, alongside red fruit and slightly meaty tones. The medium-bodied palate offers bright acidity that lifts the brambly fruit alongside savory, talc-textured tannins that are supportive but not overly clenching. Drink now–2027.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Brash Higgins 2017 NDV Amphora Project Nero d'Avola (McLaren Vale)

Description: This is a strong vintage of Montepulciano from this natural, small-batch producer. And it's wildly affordable to boot. From the hot climes of the Riverland region, where Mediterranean varietals thrive, this vintage gets it just right. It opens with appealing plum, blueberry, black pepper, baking spice, tobacco leaf and bushels of herbs. It's full and plump in the mouth but is lifted by crisp acidity and backed by spicy, leathery tannins. A balance of power and finesse, but most importantly, hugely drinkable.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Delinquente 2018 The Bullet Dodger Montepulciano (Riverland)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried berries, leather and game aromas arise on the deep and hearty nose of this bottling of a rarely seen grape in California. Black-cherry, potting-soil and pencil-shaving flavors show on the sip, which is wrapped in leathery tannins and bolstered by lively acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Pelletiere 2017 Estate Montepulciano (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: The shy nose slowly reveals Mediterranean scrub, citrus and a whiff of Spanish broom. The aromas give way to the linear palate offering sour cherry, citrus and a fennel note alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cavicchioli 2018 Vigna del Cristo  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Description: This is a seriously structured and concentrated multi-vintage blend that's based in dark chocolate, black pepper and pomegranate flavors and coated in firm, fine-grained tannins. This gutsy Italian varietal will be ideal to pair with a roast or braise.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Prima Materia NV Aglianico

Description: Ashley and Holly Ratcliff have been almost single-handedly responsible for reviving the hot South Aussie Riverland region, once a major supplier of bulk fruit to large wine companies. Through the planting of organically farmed, heat tolerant Mediterranean varieties, their quality fruit goes into the wines of many of Australia's young gun winemakers, and also into their own wines, Ricca Terra. The Nero is a deep well of cherries and blackberries, underpinned by dried herbal, graphite and hot tar notes. The palate neatly balances silky, juicy fruit and herbs with savory tannins and lifted acidity. An approachable medium- to full-bodied wine to sip with wintery fare.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Ricca Terra 2018 Small Batch Nero d'Avola (Riverland)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Rare for these parts, this hearty red is crisp and tangy, with an entry of cassis, currant and cherry. The fruity opening develops into at a thick concentration of grip and richness, with chalky tannin and fresh acidity that complements.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Denier-Handal 2015 Estate Sagrantino (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: It's rare to see Montepulciano on its own in South Australia, but it's a variety that seems happy there. This black cherry-hued version offers a deep well of aromas, from dark berry fruits to cumin and ground pepper; from black olive and sanguine notes to oak-derived spiciness. There's muscle on the palate in the form of leathery tannins, dark fruit, licorice and herbs. It's all tempered by crunchy acidity. Drink now with protein until 2029.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Mr. Riggs 2017 Generation Series D' Montepulciano (Adelaide)

Description: This is a big, boisterous and friendly wine blended from three vintages that wraps soft tannins around dusty mahogany, chocolate and cherry flavors. It is mouthfilling but not monolithic, giving a warm, broad impression on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Prima Materia NV Sagrantino

Description: Richly flavored and supple in texture, this deep-colored dry wine offers plenty of ripe blackberry and black-cherry flavors, a rounded mouthfeel and nice touches of earth and herbs. It shows mild tannins and good balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Maley 2017 Teroldego (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A deep dark color and distinctive dark-chocolate aromas and flavors distinguish this huge, structured and full-bodied wine. Black cherries and blueberries emerge on the palate while very firm tannins cling to the sides of the mouth.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Portalupi 2017 Charbono (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Vino Bianco d'Italia, Italy Other, Italy
Description: Made with 100% Nero d'Avola but vinified as a white wine, this tangy white has aromas of tropical fruit, honeysuckle and a yeasty whiff of bread dough. The palate recalls the nose, offering honeydew melon, ripe yellow pear and hints of wild herb alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Morgante 2018 di Morgante Nero d'Avola (Vino Bianco d'Italia)

Description: Enticing scents of wild berry, blue flower, exotic spice and Mediterranean scrub shape the nose. Elegantly structured, the polished palate delivers blackberry, black cherry, licorice and crushed mint alongside a backbone of smooth, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2035.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2015 Noto Santa Cecilia Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Wild berry, new leather, smoke and balsamic notes of eucalyptus shape the nose on this fragrant red. The smoky note carries over to the racy, youthfully austere palate along with Marasca cherry, pomegranate, flint and ground clove. It's ethereally elegant, with mineral tension and a backbone of firm acidity. Tight fine-grained tannins keep it balanced. Drink 2024–2034.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Guastaferro 2014 Primum  (Taurasi)

Description: Balsamic aromas of camphor mingle with mature black-skinned fruit, underbrush, leather, wet stone and oak-driven spice. On the elegantly structured, vibrant palate, firm acidity and tightly wound but polished tannins frame sour cherry, cranberry, licorice and tobacco. Drink 2021–2034.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2014 Studi Rosamilla  (Taurasi)

Description: Taut and linear, this opens with aromas of red berry, pipe tobacco and eucalyptus. The firm, elegantly structured palate delivers sour cherry, cassis, star anise and a hint of smoke before finishing on an accent of coffee. Taut, fine-grained tannins provide the framework. Drink 2023–2035.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2015 Serpico  (Taurasi)

Description: Wild berry, blue-flower, French oak and exotic spice aromas lead the way along with a whiff of eucalyptus. The linear, structured palate is still youthfully austere, offering cranberry, pomegranate, orange zest and star anise along with hints of coconut and coffee bean. Taut, close-grained tannins and vibrant acidity provide the framework. Drink 2022–2034.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2014 Studi Candriano  (Taurasi)

Description: Carob, blackberry and camphor aromas shape the nose on this young, vibrant red. It's smooth and silky, delivering raspberry compote, eucalyptus and hazelnut set against polished tannins and bright acidity. A saline note caps off the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Curto 2014 Fontanelle Nero d'Avola (Eloro)

Description: Mature dark-skinned berry, tobacco and a whiff of new leather lead the nose on this smooth, medium-bodied red. On the chewy palate, polished tannins accompany dried Marasca cherry, cassis and ground black pepper. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2017 Dal Re Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Underbrush, black-skinned fruit, new leather and balsamic aromas are front and center on this full-bodied red. It's smooth and enveloping, offering prune, ripe black cherry, tobacco and licorice alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fiorentino 2014  Taurasi

Description: This opens with aromas of prune, pressed violet, leather and molten chocolate. The rounded, accessible palate doles out dried black cherry, truffle, cassis, star anise and tobacco set against polished, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Di Meo 2012 Vino Blu Riserva  (Taurasi)

Description: Mature black-skinned berry, sunbaked earth, leather and pressed blue-flower aromas form the delicate but enticing nose along with balsamic whiffs of eucalyptus. On the linear palate, lithe, fine-grained tannins support dried cherry, cranberry, star anise and sanguine notes. It closes on a note of dried herb. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Guastaferro 2015 Memini Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Smooth and savory, this polished red has an enticing nose showing black-skinned berry, wild mint, blue flower and culinary spice. The juicy palate delivers ripe Marasca cherry, red currant, star anise and white pepper set against taut, refined tannins. Enjoy through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2017 Guarnaccio Perricone (Sicilia)

Description: Made with organically farmed Nero d'Avola, this offers compelling aromas of mature dark-skinned berry, new leather and underbrush. The savory, structured palate delivers ripe black cherry, star anise and crushed mint set alongside lithe, polished tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Montoni 2015 Vrucara Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made entirely with red grape Corinto Nero, this ruby-colored dessert wine has compelling aromas of, prune, red cherry marinated in spirits, grilled herb and walnut. The rounded palate offers baked plum, Christmas cake, vanilla and carob. It's enveloping and velvety, while fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fenech 2017 Disiato Corinto Nero (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Smooth and concentrated, this has subtle aromas suggesting underbrush, leather and steeped prune. Showing the heat of the vintage, the palate is rather evolved, offering the same prune note as the nose along with baking spice and tobacco. It's savory and ready, with polished tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Di Meo 2011 Vigna Olmo Riserva  (Taurasi)

Description: Chewy and savory, this smooth young red doles out ripe black-cherry, juicy blackberry, licorice and baking-spice flavors. It's generous and ready to enjoy, with polished tannins. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2017 Rubrato Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Aromas evoking black-skinned berry, new leather, blue flower, Asian spice and dried botanical herb waft out of the glass. On the taut, linear palate, youthfully austere, fine-grained tannins envelope cranberry, pomegranate, star anise and a hint of ground clove while surprisingly fresh acidity for the hot vintage keeps it balanced. It's still young and needs a few more years to unwind. Drink 2023–2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2015  Taurasi

Description: Aromas of cassis, dark berry and spice form the nose of this Nero d'Avola. The savory, full-bodied palate delivers ripe black cherry, blackberry jam and black pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Sàgana Tenuta San Giacomo Vigneto del Torrone Bianco
Name: Cusumano 2016 Sàgana Tenuta San Giacomo Vigneto del Torrone Bianco Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of mature dark-skinned berry and Mediterranean scrub lead the nose on this 100% Nero d'Avola. The bright palate delivers blackberry jam, star anise and white pepper alongside pliant tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Donnafugata 2018 Sherazade Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Deli meat, black olive and earthy dried herb give this wine a heady aromatic profile that follows suit on the bright, acid-driven palate. A touch of oak provides support without distraction.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Mengler Family Wines 2017 Alegria Vineyards Dolcetto (Russian River Valley)

Description: Aromas of mature dark-skinned berry and Mediterranean scrub lead the nose on this 100% Nero d'Avola. The bright palate delivers blackberry jam, star anise and white pepper alongside pliant tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Donnafugata 2018 Sherazade Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling of a rarely seen grape needs decanting or plenty of patience to properly open, but it's very intriguing once it does. Aromas of boysenberry, black licorice and graham cracker lead into a palate of black plum and lilac that develop from sour to richer as the wine breathes.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Pelletiere 2017 Riserva Lagrein (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Description: Violet, wild berry, clove and a whiff of leather form the nose. On the firm palate, bright acidity and taut fine-grained tannins accompany red cherry, vanilla and star anise before a coffee finish. Drink 2021–3030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: I Capitani 2013 Bosco Faiano  (Taurasi)

Description: Mature dark-skinned berry, new leather and underbrush aromas mingle with balsamic notes on this ripe medium-bodied red. On the smooth, concentrated palate, lithe tannins accompany juicy black cherry, raspberry jam, star anise and a dollop of vanilla. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Meriggio 2015 Aglianico (Irpinia)

Description: Tangy and easy-drinking, this savory rosato offers mouthfuls of crushed raspberry, morello cherry and blueberry while baking-spice notes add interest. Crisp acidity keeps it clean and refreshing. There's no complexity but it is delicious.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Morgante 2018 Rosé di Morgante Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, violet and a whiff of Mediterranean brush lift out of the glass. Made with Nero d'Avola, the juicy palate offers blackberry, white pepper and clove alongside polished tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cusumano 2018 Tenuta San Giacomo Disueri Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This Nerello Mascalese opens with aromas of cedar, mocha and dark-skinned fruit. The firm palate offers dried cherry, espresso and sage alongside assertive tannins that grip the finish. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Alberelli di Giodo 2017 Nerello Mascalese (Sicilia)

Description: Made with organically farmed Frappato, this opens with intense aromas of red berry, Mediterranean brush and orange zest. The juicy, light-bodied palate offers crushed strawberry, nutmeg and white pepper alongside vibrant acidity and pliant tannins. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gorghi Tondi 2018 Dumè Frappato (Sicilia)

Appellation: Terre del Volturno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of new leather, dried herb, dark-skinned berry and green peppercorn follow over to the fresh, medium-bodied palate along with licorice notes. Lithe tannins provide polished support.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vigne Chigi 2018 Casavecchia (Terre del Volturno)

Description: Made with organically grown Nero d'Avola, this offers aromas of black-skinned berry and Mediterranean scrub. The straightforward, accessible palate shows black cherry, star anise and a hint of clove alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cortese 2017 Senia Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made from organically grown Frappato grapes, this offers aromas of red berry and baking spice. The juicy palate shows strawberry, sour cherry and white pepper alongside polished tannins. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo di Santa Tresa 2018 Frappato (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made with organically grown Nero d'Avola, this opens with aromas of dark berry, graphite and baking spice. The dense palate offers black-cherry jam, tobacco and clove set against round tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fina 2017 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This bright Nero d'Avola offers juicy red berry, Mediterranean brush and black pepper that carry over to the savory palate alongside smooth tannins. It's made to be enjoyed young so drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: MandraRossa 2018 Costadune Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of French oak, tobacco and violet mingle with whiffs of mature black-skinned fruit. On the rather evolved palate, plushy tannins accompany raspberry jam and hints of vanilla. Drink sooner rather than later.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Antica Masseria del Sigillo 2011 Ellenico  (Taurasi)

Description: Made entirely with Nero d'Avola, this opens with aromas of ripe black plum, cedar and cooking spice. The straightforward palate offers blueberry jam, white pepper and a dollop of vanilla alongside round tannins. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Morgante 2016 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This Nero d'Avola opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit and exotic spice. The straightforward palate offers dried black cherry and vanilla alongside forward tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nero Oro 2016 Riserva Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made entirely with Nero d'Avola, this offers aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, scorched earth and a whiff of cinnamon. Reflecting the nose, the straightforward palate offers dried black cherry, baking spice and vanilla alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Bastonaca 2018 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Dried plum, cherry and raisin cake give this full-bodied wine an enduring richness and intensity around soft, firm tannin and oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Benessere 2016 Holystone Vineyard Aglianico (St. Helena)

Description: This Frappato has aromas of candied berry and white pepper. The aromas carry over to the light-bodied palate along with soft tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Bastonaca 2017 Frappato (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Red berry, vineyard dust and a whiff of carob shape the nose. On the enjoyable palate, orange zest and saline accompany blueberry jam and lemon thyme alongside tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Curto 2018 Rosato EOS Nero d'Avola (Eloro)

Description: Made with organically grown Nero d'Avola, this opens with aromas of roasted coffee bean, toasted oak and ripe dark-skinned berry. The assertive palate offers blackberry jam, mocha and toasted oak alongside close-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo di Santa Tresa 2016 Avulisi Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made with organically grown Nero d'Avola grapes, this has aromas of dark-skinned berry, Mediterranean brush and baking spice. The easygoing, light-bodied palate offers blackberry jam, star anise and a touch of white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gorghi Tondi 2018 Luce di Luna Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and dark black-fruit aromas pick up an earthy tone on the nose of this bottling, which also shows hints of prune, chocolate and grape seed. Sour fruits meet with cocoa on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bethel Road 2016 Charbono (Templeton Gap District)

Description: Made with organically grown Nero d'Avola, this has aromas of ripe dark-skinned fruit and tilled soil. The mature palate offers blackberry extract, star anise and cocoa alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantine Grasso 2017 Lilium Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: This Nero d'Avola has aromas suggesting dark-skinned fruit and baking spice. The round palate offers blackberry jam, vanilla and a hint of cooking spice alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantine Grasso 2017 Sette Aia Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Made with organically grown Nerello Mascalese, this opens with delicate aromas of red berry and underbrush. The lean, linear palate offers sour cherry and a hint of star anise alongside lithe tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cortese 2018 Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made with organically grown Nero d'Avola, this informal wine opens with aromas of dark berry and cooking spice. The aromas carry over to the simple palate along with smooth tannins and the merest touch of white pepper. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantine Ermes 2018 Vento di Mare Bio Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Smooth and easygoing, this light-bodied red has aromas of wild red berry and whiffs of dark spice. On the soft, simple palate, pliant tannins loosely support fleshy blackberry and a hint of tobacco. Drink now.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Guardiense 2017 Janare Aglianico (Beneventano)

Description: Made with Nero d'Avola, this easygoing red has subdued aromas of dark-skinned fruit and a whiff of brown spice. The simple palate offers mature black plum, tangerine zest and a dollop of vanilla alongside round tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nero Oro 2018 Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made with organically grown Nero d'Avola, this has aromas of dark fruit and baking spice that carry over to the easygoing palate along with round tannins and the merest hint of black pepper. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: TerrAmore 2018 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals aromas suggesting prune, weedy underbrush and toasted oak that carry over to the lean, rather diluted palate along with coffee bean and saw dust. It seems more evolved than its age, with loose, fleeting tannins. Drink sooner rather than later.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nativ 2016 Rue  (Taurasi)

Description: This informal Nero d'Avola has aromas suggesting dark-skinned fruit and scorched earth. The simple palate offers blackberry and a hint of star anise alongside relaxed tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Botter 2018 Caleo Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Appellation: Monica di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of Mediterranean scrub and grilled herb lead the nose on this informal red. The light-bodied, diluted palate suggests dried blackberry, a green note of powdered sage and bitter unroasted coffee bean alongside dusty fleeting tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Dolia Nova 2018  Monica di Sardegna

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Crisp and delicious, this vibrant wine has aromas of strawberry, orange zest and violet. On the savory palate, tangy acidity accompanies crushed red cherry, pomegranate, white pepper and star anise set against a polished mousse. A hint of bread crust lingers on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paltrinieri 2018 Leclisse  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: One of the best Lambruscos out there, this delicious, vibrant wine opens with enticing scents of wild red berry, yellow stone fruit, citrus blossom and a yeasty, comforting whiff of pastry dough. Made by carrying out the secondary fermentation in the bottle, the dry, delicious palate delivers pink grapefruit, crushed strawberry and tangerine alongside crisp acidity and a saline note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paltrinieri 2018 Radice  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Red berry, orange zest, pastry and eucalyptus aromas waft out of the glass. On the savory palate, tangy acidity accompanies strawberry, nectarine and lemon slice alongside bright acidity and a vibrant, refined perlage. It's totally delicious and refreshing.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paltrinieri 2015 Grosso Metodo Classico  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made with the ancestral method of bottle fermentation, this has aromas of woodland berry, wildflower and a yeasty whiff of bread crust. It's dry and savory, offering raspberry compote, orange zest and fennel alongside tangy acidity and a light mousse. It's refreshing and delicious.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Soliera NV Il Trovador  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Lightly colored, this has delicate aromas suggesting wildflower, red berry a hint of bread crust. The linear palate offers orange zest, strawberry, sour cherry and a white-almond close alongside tangy acidity. An elegant perlage provides finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paltrinieri 2017 La Riserva  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Description: Bread-crust, wild-berry and spring-blossom aromas waft out of the glass. Made with Aglianico, the tangy palate offers strawberry, saline and hazelnut alongside an elegant perlage and vibrant acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Dubl NV Metodo Classico Brut Rosé Aglianico (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Bread dough, rose petal and violet form the delicate, inviting nose along with a whiff of herb. On the tangy palate, bright acidity accompanies strawberry, grapefruit and tangerine drop, while a creamy mousse lends finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Rosé del Cristo Brut Metodo Classico
Name: Cavicchioli 2015 Rosé del Cristo Brut Metodo Classico  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Description: Here's an unusual red sparkler that opens with aromas of underbrush, toasted hazelnut, prune and grilled herb. The dry palate shows remarkable freshness for a 13-year-old wine, offering blackberry jam, spiced blueberry and bread crust alongside crisp acidity and a refined perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Metodo Classico Rosso Brut in Correggio
Name: Lini 910 2006 Metodo Classico Rosso Brut in Correggio Lambrusco Salamino (Vino Spumante)

Description: Delicate scents evoking bread crust, red berry and peach mingle with a floral note of field flower. On the savory elegant palate, a soft perlage accompanies strawberry, pomegranate, tangerine and a hint of ginger before a crisp finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina della Volta 2014 Rosé Metodo Classico Lambrusco di Sorbara (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Modena, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Heady aromas of blueberry and wild cherry lead the nose on this delicious, lively wine. On the lightly sparkling palate, hints of botanical herb and white pepper accent raspberry compote, blueberry and lemon zest before a crisp dry finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Medici Ermete NV Phermento Frizzante Secco  (Lambrusco di Modena)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of wild red berry, violet and a yeasty whiff of bread dough form the nose on this lightly sparkling wine while the crisp dry palate offers strawberry, cherry and a hint of citrus alongside racy acidity. Made with secondary fermentation carried out in the bottle, the yeasts remain on the bottom, giving it a cloudy appearance but the most savory glass is the last.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina della Volta 2018 Rimosso  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of blackberry and blueberry carry over to the dry, savory palate along with graphite and a hint of star anise before an almond close. Racy acidity keeps it fresh while fine-grained tannins lend structure and more finesse than is typical of the variety.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Settecani di Castelvetro NV Vini del Re  (Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro)

Description: Mediterranean herb and camphor aromas follow over to the palate along with pomegranate, orange zest and bitter almond. It's fresh, with bright acidity, while an elegant perlage keeps it polished.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Murgo 2011 Metodo Classico Extra Brut Nerello Mascalese (Vino Spumante)

Description: Gorgeous, generous and packed with delicious black-fruit flavors, this full-bodied wine is big and lovable. Blended from the 2016 and 2017 vintages, it shows blackberry, black-cherry and black-pepper flavors that are supported by a firm but not overly tannic texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Prima Materia NV Negroamaro

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A lively angular texture and bold well-delineated fruit, herb and smoke flavors make this full-boded wine arresting. It piles wood char on black pepper on ripe blackberries for a unique combination that's fun to explore.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terra d'Oro 2017 Aglianico (Amador County)

Description: Violet, wild berry and bread crust aromas form the nose. On the juicy palate, racy acidity supports red cherry, raspberry and a hint of star anise alongside a lively perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina della Volta 2014 Trentasei Metodo Classico Lambrusco di Sorbara (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Structured and crisp, this linear sparkler opens with aromas of black-skinned berry and a whiff of violet. The racy palate delivers wild blueberry, juicy blackberry and ground clove alongside dusty tannins and vibrant acidity that makes it incredibly refreshing. It closes on an almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa di Corlo 2018 Corleto  (Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of violet and red berry lift out of the glass. On the lightly sparkling palate, crisp acidity lifts tart sour cherry, juicy strawberry and a hint of orange zest before a dry refreshing close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Soliera NV  Lambrusco di Sorbara

Description: Made with equal parts of organically farmed Sorbara and Grasparossa grapes, this opens with aromas of violet and red berry. The juicy palate offers red cherry, crushed strawberry and white pepper alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Venturini Baldini 2018 Cadelvento Brut  (Lambrusco Reggiano)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Fun and refreshing, this lightly sparkling wine doles out juicy strawberry, raspberry and orange-zest flavors accented with hints of bread dough. It's dry, with a crisp close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Sorbara 2018 Omaggio a Gino Friedman  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Violet and red=berry aromas form the nose while the lightly sparkling palate offers strawberry, pomegranate and orange zest alongside crisp acidity. It has a clean, refreshing close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paltrinieri 2018 Piria Frizzante Secco  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Description: Aromas of bread crust, orange rind and apricot lift out of the glass. Made with 100% Sagrantino, the tangy palate offers sour cherry, pink grapefruit and a hint of hazelnut alongside a lively perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Scacciadiavoli NV Brut Metodo Classico Sagrantino (Vino Spumante)

Description: Bold oak spices meet equally bold and ripe berry flavors in this full-bodied, rich and mouthfilling wine. Aromas of freshly sawn oak and vanilla lead to plump blackberry and boysenberry flavors and full body, but not a lot of tannin.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Klinker Brick 2016 Dolcetto (Lodi)

Appellation: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas suggesting bread dough and dark-skinned berry form the subtle nose. Crisp and bone dry, the palate offers dried blueberry, blackberry and almond alongside racy acidity and dusty tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cavicchioli 2018 Col Sasso  (Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro)

Description: Made entirely from Lambrusco Salamino, this opens with aromas of red berry and clove. The off-dry palate offers raspberry jam, spiced blueberry and a touch of almond alongside vibrant acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paltrinieri 2018 Solco Frizzante Semisecco  (Lambrusco dell'Emilia)

Appellation: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Racy and deeply colored, this frothy wine offers blackberry, blueberry and bitter almond flavors. It's bone-dry and refreshing, with crisp acidity and dusty tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa di Corlo 2018  Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro

Description: Crisp and refreshing, this has aromas of crushed blue flower, red berry and a yeasty whiff of bread crust. On the dry crisp palate, a lively perlage accompanies wild red cherry, raspberry compote and a note of orange zest.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina della Volta 2016 Butrosso Metodo Classico Lambrusco di Sorbara (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of wild red berry, violet and citrus zest lead the nose. On the lively, lightly sparkling palate, racy acidity accompanies orange slice, strawberry and raspberry.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Medici Ermete NV Quercioli  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made entirely with Lambrusco di Sorbara grapes, this lightly tinted wine has an extremely shy nose. The bone-dry palate is also subdued but refreshing, suggesting hints of sour cherry and bread crust, alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina della Volta 2015 La Prima Volta Dosaggio Zero  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This has aromas of red berry and rose petal. The aromas carry over to the light-bodied semisweet palate, along with strawberry jam, candied tangerine and a foaming mousse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Sorbara 2018 Emma Frizzante Amabile  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Fruity aromas of blackberry and blueberry jam follow over to the softly sparkling, sweet palate along with a confectionery note. Tangy acidity and a foaming mousse provide the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Settecani di Castelvetro NV Amabile  (Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Sorbara, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Vinous aromas of grape must mingle with a whiff of field flower on this fun sparkler. Racy and refreshing, the tangy palate offers juicy red cherry, strawberry and a hint of citrus before a dry crisp finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa di Corlo 2018 Primevo  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

Appellation: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This red sparkling dessert wine opens with ripe dark berry and candied orange-zest aromas. The semisweet, foaming palate offers blackberry jam and baking spice alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa di Corlo NV Amabile  (Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro)

Appellation: Lambrusco di Modena, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Vinous aromas of grape must carry on to the palate, along with cherry jam and a candied note. It's crisp, with brisk acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Carpi 2018 Piazza Grande  (Lambrusco di Modena)

Description: Serve this organic red wine chilled to damp down the earthy aromas that cover what are actually quite lively and fruity flavors underneath.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Frey 2016 Organic Dolcetto (Mendocino)

Description: Underbrush, wild berry, blue flower, camphor and wet stone aromas lift out of the glass. The smooth palate is loaded with finesse, delivering succulent red cherry, strawberry compote, blood orange, star anise and a hint of tobacco framed in taut, polished tannins. Bright acidity keeps it beautifully balanced, and a tangy mineral note graces the close. Drink 2023–2036.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tascante 2016 Contrada Pianodario Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Violet, Mediterranean herb, ripe red berries and a whiff of bread crust shape the fragrant nose. A heady combination of crisp and smooth, the radiant, chiseled palate delivers red currant, red cherry, citrus and flinty mineral alongside an elegant, refined perlage that lends finesse. It's balanced, with vibrant acidity that gives a tangy close to the dry finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Murgo 2014 Metodo Classico Extra Brut Rosé Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Rose, violet, red berry, Mediterranean scrub and eucalyptus aromas form the nose on this fragrant red. The elegant palate is still young and nervous, offering juicy raspberry, cherry, star anise and orange slice set against vibrant acidity and taut, refined tannins. A tangy mineral note and brown spice linger on the finish. It needs time to calm down a bit, but it will age beautifully. Drink 2023–2036.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tascante 2016 Contrada Sciaranuova Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Citrus, Spanish broom and Mediterranean scrub aromas lift out of the glass along with a eucalyptus note. Dry, savory and elegant, the palate offers white grapefruit, white cherry, thyme and a saline mineral note. Vibrant acidity gives it a crisp, clean finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Murgo 2017 Metodo Classico Brut Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Aromas of spring wild flowers, red berries, citrus and Mediterranean scrub waft out of the glass. The vibrant, linear palate shows pomegranate, sour cherry and tangerine, and a light brioche note graces the close. It's balanced, with a silky perlage and crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Murgo 2017 Metodo Classico Brut Rosé Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Wild berry and Mediterranean herb aromas lead the way on this vibrant rosato. On the tangy palate, crisp acidity accompanies sour cherry, Meyer lemon, unripe yellow peach and a hint of wild thyme. It closes on a saline note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Theresa Eccher 2018 Rosato Ariel Nerello Mascalese (Etna)

Description: Bread crust, violet and apple aromas emerge from the glass. On the tangy palate, a soft mousse accompanies blueberry, citrus and a hint of brioche.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Principi di Butera NV Pas Dosé Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of red currant, fragrant yellow wildflowers and Mediterranean scrub almost jump out of the glass. The vibrant, light-bodied palate offers raw cranberry, white cherry, citrus and a hint of saline alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gorghi Tondi 2018 Rosa dei Venti Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Aromas of orange zest, brandy and walnut with a whiff of sardine carry over to the palate along with bitter yellow apple skin and a candied note. Steely, rather harsh bubbles provide the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Patria NV Pàlici Brut Spumante Metodo Classico  (Etna)

Description: Spiced blueberry and blackberry brandy aromas shape the nose along with a whiff of rose. The enveloping, delicious palate shows a polished concentration, delivering ripe black cherry, plum, carob and baking spice. Firm, velvety tannins and fresh acidity provide the framing. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Fratelli Pardi 2014 Sacrantino  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: Aromas of baked plum, purple flowers, exotic spices and French oak form the nose on this full-bodied red. The firmly structured palate shows focus and finesse, delivering ripe black cherry, spiced blueberry, licorice and tobacco alongside tightly knit, fine-grained tannins that leave a rather drying finish. Give it time to fully develop. Drink 2023–2035.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Arnaldo Caprai 2015 25 Anni  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: From the winery's estate in Castel del Monte, this Aglianico boasts a dense dark-berry aroma on the nose, with shades of anise, crushed peppercorn and violet. There's richness to the firm palate that's built by flavors of thick-skinned dark berries and earthy spice. While approachable now, it should cellar well for years to come. Drink through 2029.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tormaresca 2014 Bocca Di Lupo Aglianico (Castel del Monte)

Description: Spiced plum, tobacco, rose and citrusy aromas shape the nose. On the full-bodied, enveloping palate, firm, grainy tannins accompany dried black cherry, raisin and baking spice. The fruit richness easily stands up to the hefty alcohol, while fresh acidity lends balance. Drink 2020–2034.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Fratelli Pardi 2014  Montefalco Sagrantino

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Dense aromas of dark berries meld with subtle accents of cinnamon, violet and anise on the nose of this wine that's sourced from the winery's Castel del Monte estate. There's a plushness to the palate where thick-skinned dark berries are holding court alongside baking spice and earthy undertones, with firm tannins and bright acidity lending support to the whole. Drink through 2027.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tormaresca 2015 Bocca Di Lupo Aglianico (Castel del Monte)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Grown on the limestone hills of the Castel del Monte region, this is an elegant Aglianico that displays an intense nose of crushed pink peppercorn, dried violet, hibiscus and tobacco. The medium-bodied palate is driven by persistent acidity and a mineral vein that are tightly coiled around tart red berry, spice and earth flavors. There's a lot of intensity to this wine that needs to unravel, including its firm, grippy tannins. Drink from 2022.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Rivera 2013 Cappellaccio Riserva Aglianico (Castel del Monte)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong aromas of dark plum, oregano and wild thyme show on the nose of this bottling of a warm-weather grape from one of the region's hotter vineyards. Grippy tannins and a bright acidity frame the palate, where flavors of plum, berry, pepper and savory meat elements arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Giornata 2017 French Camp Vineyard Aglianico (Paso Robles)

Description: Aromas of stewed prunes, blue flowers and exotic spices lead the way along with whiffs of underbrush. The full-bodied palate doles out baked plum, steeped cherry, licorice and mocha before a sage finish. Close-grained tannins lend firm support. Drink 2022–2036.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Montioni 2016  Montefalco Sagrantino

Description: Aromas of blueberry brandy, underbrush, dark spice and eucalyptus take shape in the glass. On the tightly knit, brawny palate, assertive, close-grained tannins support dried black cherry, licorice and clove alongside the heat of evident alcohol.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Arnaldo Caprai 2015 Valdimaggio  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: Resin, black-skinned berries, exotic spices and baked plum aromas slowly take shape on this along with whiffs of French oak. Densely concentrated, the firm, muscular palate offers blackberry jam, prune, vanilla and coconut set against assertive, close-grained tannins that clench the finish. Drink after 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Lungarotti 2015  Montefalco Sagrantino

Description: Aromas of underbrush and prune and a whiff of pressed rose come together in the glass along with a resin note. Concentrated and enveloping, the rounded, full-bodied palate offers dried cherry, raisin, licorice and tobacco, all framed in tightly knit, close-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Goretti 2015  Montefalco Sagrantino

Description: From the winery's Salento estate located in the Brindisi province, this Negroamaro shows a wealth of black olive, game, pepper and brandied dark berries on the nose. The firm, medium-bodied palate is framed by polished tannins that prop up a complex mix of fruit, spice and savory qualities that echo the nose. A tangy mineral note propels freshness from the start to the lingering finish. Drink from 2022.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tormaresca 2015 Masseria Maìme Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berries, toasted oak and underbrush lead the nose. The spicy, structured palate offers dried black cherry, black pepper, tobacco and clove alongside tight, close-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Arnaldo Caprai 2015 Collepiano  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: Aromas of steeped plum and baking spice and a whiff of rose lift out of the glass. Round and concentrated, the full-bodied, enveloping palate doles out fleshy black cherry, blackberry jam and cinnamon alongside close-grained, dusty tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Roccafiore 2014  Montefalco Sagrantino

Description: A wealth of savory spice starts off this wine: anise and Chinese five spice powder are joined by orange and game. The full-bodied palate is big and plush in feel, filled out by ripe dark cherry and blackberry flavors. Despite the massive feel, there's plenty of balance from tangy acidity and a lifted mineral element. The tannins offer grip but remain in check, providing ample support for all that fruit.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Poderi d'Agostino 2016 F.D. Nero di Troia (Murgia)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This red offers an intense nose of tobacco, game, violet and peppery spice, with rich cherry filling out the core. Starting out rounded and plump on the medium-bodied palate, bright acidity and a tangy mineral note quickly pick up and lend a fine, taut feel alongside sinewy tannins. The finish lingers on savory spice tones.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Torrevento 2014 Ottagono Riserva Nero di Troia (Castel del Monte)

Description: Made with organically grown grapes and fermented in amphorae, this brawny red has a shy nose that eventually reveals stewed plum, moist earth and game. Densely concentrated, the ripe palate doles out blackberry jam, prune and baking spice alongside solid, enveloping tannins that leave a firm, drying finish. You'll also notice the heat of evident alcohol on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fongoli 2013 Francaton  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: Earthy aromas of tobacco and leather meld with a balsamic cherry note on the nose. There's weight to the medium-bodied palate, with racy acidity pushing through to clean up the clench of the sinewy, dry tannins. Tobacco and violet linger on the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Masseria Li Veli 2016 Pezzo Morgana Riserva Negroamaro (Salice Salentino)

Description: Baked plum, coconut, toast, vanilla, nail polish and resin aromas mingle together on this brawny red. The solid palate shows French oak, roasted coffee bean and stewed prune alongside grainy tannins. You'll also notice the heat of evident alcohol. Give the tannins another year or two to soften, then drink to capture the remaining fruit.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Scacciadiavoli 2015  Montefalco Sagrantino

Description: Baked plum, coconut, toast, vanilla, nail polish and resin aromas mingle together on this brawny red. The solid palate shows French oak, roasted coffee bean and stewed prune alongside grainy tannins. You'll also notice the heat of evident alcohol. Give the tannins another year or two to soften, then drink to capture the remaining fruit.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Scacciadiavoli 2015  Montefalco Sagrantino

Description: Aromas of baked cherry dipped in liquor, tobacco and menthol show nice concentration on the nose. The medium-bodied palate offers a cherry jam flavor, with a stony, tangy element rising up on the finish. There's good acidic lift and a firm framing of tannins that support the medium-concentrated core.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Di Majo Norante 2013 Don Luigi Riserva Montepulciano (Molise)

Description: This muscular red has subdued aromas suggesting black-skinned fruit, leather and spice. The assertive palate is lean on fruit richness, suggesting steeped prune, leather, ground clove and evident alcohol set against aggressive, grainy tannins that clench the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fongoli 2013  Montefalco Sagrantino

Description: Earthy tones of hot soil and clove meld with strawberry and cherry on the nose. The palate is supersmooth in feel, lifted by tangy acidity and a light mineral vein.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Masseria Li Veli 2017 Askos Susumaniello (Salento)

Description: Light aromas of peppery spice, violet and cranberry start off this Negroamaro. There's a softness to the feel at first, yet bright acidity quickly brightens up the palate and propels along the flavors of tart red berries. Light tannins and ripe cherry show good resolve on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Leone de Castris 2017 Maiana Negroamaro (Salice Salentino)

Description: Lifted aromas of violet, pink peppercorn and hibiscus carry this unoaked Nero di Troia. It is vibrant and juicy on the palate, displaying bright cranberry and cherry flavors accented by plenty of floral and spice tones. The tannins are smooth and integrated, while the acidity propels it all along.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Torrevento 2015 Torre Del Falco Nero di Troia (Puglia)

Description: A dense nose of brandied dark cherries melds with intense accents of savory and sweet spices. The firm palate boasts condensed dark fruit flavors that are bolstered by tangy acidity and fine-grained tannins. There's a bit of thickness to the fruit on the midpalate, yet savory spice tones lift it up by the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Vespa 2015 Helena Nero di Troia (Puglia)

Description: Aromas of allspice and juniper mesh well with the ripe cherry core in this wine. Lifted acidity is matched by smooth tannins to give a solid home for tart red berry and spice flavors.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Due Palme 2018 Canonico Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: Cherry and bramble berry aromas meld with violet and pepper on the nose. There's a pleasing roundness to the medium-bodied palate, with bright acidity pushing through to deliver a bit of crunch behind all the fruit.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Masseria Altemura 2017 Negroamaro (Salento)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A wealth of cured meat and anise aromas carry the nose, with purple flowers and cranberry at the core. The medium-bodied palate shows tart red and blue berries ensconced in toasty oak and violet. The tannins are spicy and a bit grainy, giving grit and grip to the whole. A tangy mineral tone pervades throughout to offer lift.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Grifo 2014 Augustale Riserva Nero di Troia (Castel del Monte)

Description: Aromas of cola, anise and brandy-soaked dark cherry mark the nose, with peppery spice lingering in the background. The palate is rather soft and easy in feel, yet there's just enough acidity to keep it lifted. Cherry and crushed pepper mark the short finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantele 2015 Riserva Negroamaro (Salice Salentino)

Description: Aromas of dark cherry and blackberry coulis meld with a proper dose of sweet spice on the nose. It is rounded and plush on the palate in ripe berry flavors, with juicy acidity and fine-grained tannins propping it all up.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Varvaglione 2015 12 e Mezzo Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: A bright, fruity nose of red cherry melds with cinnamon and clove. A medium-bodied palate is juicy in red and black berry flavors, flecked with sweet spices. The tannins show a mild grit, with honed acidity providing balance.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Due Palme 2017 Serre Susumaniello (Salento)

Description: Aromas of stewed prune and toasted oak with a whiff of resin lead the nose. The assertive palate reflects the nose, offering raisin, clove and French oak. It lacks fruit richness, and grainy tannins give it a clenching, astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Montioni 2015 Ma Gia  (Montefalco Sagrantino)

Description: A straightforward nose of warm spices and violets carries to the silky palate. Creamy cherry meets vanilla and clove flavors, supported by light tannins and balanced acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Grifo 2018 Nero di Troia (Puglia)

Description: Subdued aromas of stewed prune, underbrush, resin and French oak eventually appear in the glass. The assertive palate is lean in terms of fruit richness, offering raisin, powdered sage and oak-driven spice alongside grainy, clenching tannins that leave an extremely astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria Colsanto 2013  Montefalco Sagrantino

Description: Aromas of cherry and tobacco take on a balsamic undertone on the nose. Bright acidity and slightly grainy tannins frame the light-bodied palate, with tart dark-fruit flavors that show a pleasing level of vitality.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Barocco 2017 Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: There's a good amount of oak on the nose in tones of coffee and cocoa that override the dark berry core. The palate shows a bit more balance in flavors of tart red and black berries carried along by a tangy granite twang. The tannins are firm yet in check.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Jorche 2015 Caleido Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: Aromas of geranium and tilled earth ride over a lightly concentrated core of candied cherry on the nose. There's a slight prickle to the entry of the palate, with easygoing red berry flavors that meld with earthy floral and warm spice tones.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Claudio Quarta 2016 Tenute Eméra Anima di Negroamaro (Lizzano)

Description: Aromas of cherry jam and raspberry carry the nose of this light-bodied red. It is slim in profile, driven by zesty acidity and delicate, stony tannins. The fruit concentration is light, and its overall profile would lend well to a slight chill (as the label does suggest).                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Teanum 2017 Òtre Fish Negroamaro (Puglia)

Description: This wine offers dark-fruit flavors that are propped up by grippy tannins. Flecks of peppery spice and potpourri give good interest, yet the tannins rise up on the finish with a copper penny tang.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantine LeGrotte 2017 Petrata Nero di Troia (Puglia)

Description: A veil of frankincense and smoke seems disjointed from the ripe cherry core on the nose. The palate is smooth and slick in feel, yet driven by a wealth of toasty, oaky spices.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Mottura 2018 Negroamaro (Salento)

Description: Aromas of crushed stone, green tobacco and underripe berries translate to the light-bodied palate. This is very light in concentration with raspy tannins rising up on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Torrevento 2017 É Arte Negroamaro (Puglia)

Description: Aromas of spiced blackberry, cherry and fig offer a solid core to the nose, lifted by accents of fresh tobacco leaf and tilled earth. The medium-bodied palate is built by a firm grip of tannins that house concentrated berry and cigar flavors, with tangy granite and integrated acidity pushing through. Drink now–2023.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Contesa 2013 Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
